characters: DOZENS OF CARS HEADING STRAIGHT FOR THEM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One small step for man, one large pile of garbage for moo kind.  Untouched for years, the flag stands next to the castoff remains of the Apollo mission.  Slowly the discar equipment begins to RATTLE and SHAKE. AN ENORMOUS SHADOW creeps towards us blotting out the hor a loud RUMBLE is heard. Suddenly we are covered in DARKNESS as the SHADOW engulfs Only the lonely image of our EARTH hangs in the air, unti huge silhouetted OBJECT suddenly blocks our view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A field of large satellite dishes scan the skies. Super up: S.E.T.I. INSTITUTE, NEW MEXICO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone TECHNICIAN works on his putting skills.  Behind hi wall to wall technical equipment quietly sifts through da A RED LIGHT begins to flash. The Technician turns and slowly walks towards the source. by one a series of LIGHTS turn on.  The Technician (TECH grabs a pair of headphones.  His eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleepily a SUPERVISOR picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this isn't an insanely beautiful woman, I'm hanging up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and listen. He holds the phone up to a speaker, increases the volume. strange FLUCTUATING TONE plays out in sequential patterns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEARING it, the Supervisor BOLTS UP, banging his head on bunk above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pajama party on acid.  Five other technicians, in vario states of undress, hover anxiously around the main consol The Supervisor enters, tying his robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I hope it's not just another damned Russian spy job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative.  Computer affirms the  signal is unidentified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hanging up the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy from Air Res Traffic say the  skies are clear.  No terrestrial launches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the real thing.  A radio signal from another world. The room becomes quiet as they realize that after years o searching the heavens, they might have finally found something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not jump the gun.  Run a trajectory source computation. Tech Three slides over to another computer. SUPERVISOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know exactly where it's coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be right. Tech Three just stares at his screen in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calculated distance from source is at three hundred and eight five thousand kilometers. (turning to Supervisor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming from the moon. The Supervisor reaches over and turns up the volume on th speaker.  As they listen to the strange TONES we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elevator doors OPENS revealing four star GENERAL GREY, Commander in Chief U.S. Space Command.  Understandably nervous, the COMMANDING OFFICER escorts him down the hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else knows about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S.E.T.I. in New Mexico identified a signal but they're even more confused than we are. The General shoots him a disapproving glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Sir. He slides his security card through the lock and the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banks of computers, Technicians and assistants working feverishly through the night.  The Officers cross the roo Super: SPACE COMMAND - THE PENTAGON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satellite reception has been impaired but we were able to get these. They arrive at a glass table.  The surrounding officers s to attention as a SECOND OFFICER quickly brings over a la transparency.  We SEE a grainy image of a large vague OBJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a big turd. The two Officers exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We estimate it has a diameter of over five hundred and fifty kilometers and a mass roughly one fourth the size of our moon. The General turns to the Second Officer, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A meteor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Sir.  Definitely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, er... it's slowing down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's doing what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... slowing down, Sir. The General walks over to a phone, picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the Secretary of Defense. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then wake him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laying in bed THOMAS J. WHITMORE reads a stack of papers. phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtering through phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. It's me. The warm look on Whitmore's face tells us everything abou he feels about the woman on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi honey.  What time is it there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in a night gown, MRS. MARGARET WHITMORE unpacks h briefing papers lays them out on a small desk as she talk Through the window we SEE Los Angeles at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two in the morning.  I know I didn't wake you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitmore sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a confession to make. There's a beautiful young blonde sleeping next to me. Sleeping next to him, his six-year-old daughter, PATRICIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't let her stay up watching T.V. all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. The little girl stirs awake, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're flying back right after the luncheon?  Okay, here she is. Whitmore hands her the phone and gets out of bed.  Habita he turns on the television.

dialogues.speaker: T.V.
dialogues.text: Several "Pundits" sit around a MaLaughlin-type news discu program.  The picture quality is snowy, static ridden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the inexperience in public office was inevitably going to catch up with him.  He's scarified his ideals for "politics as usual." Whitmore ties on his robe as he adjusts the picture quali

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I said this during the campaign.  Leadership as a pilot in the Gulf War has no relationship to political leadership.  It's a different animal... Suddenly the channel changes.  A cartoon comes on.  Whitm turns to his daughter who holds he remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy let me watch Letterman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitmore exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Whitmore steps out of his bedroom, a Security guard sn to attention.  Someone hidden behind a newspaper, sits on bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, George. The paper is dropped revealing CONSTANCE HALBROOK, mid- thirties, aggressive, sharp, the President's communicatio director.  Quickly she gathers her things and follows Whitmore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two servants are preparing breakfast as Whitmore and Cons enter.  Whitmore sits down, grabs a coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're up early this morning, Connie. She tosses him one of the many newspapers in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not attacking your policies, they're attacking your age. (another paper; reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...addressing Congress, Whitmore seems less like the President and more like the orphan child Oliver asking, 'please sir, I'd like some more.'"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Age was never an issue when you stuck to your gun.  You were thought of as young and idealistic.  But the message has gotten lost.  There's too much compromise, too much politics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it amazing how fast everyone can turn against you. Realizing she may be pushing him too far, she hands him another paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the Orange County Register has named you one of the ten sexiest men of the year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, substance at last. An AIDE appears at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. President.  It's the Secretary of Defense. Whitmore goes to the phone, picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?  Say that again?

dialogues.speaker: AN OLD RUSSIAN SATELLITE
dialogues.text: Drifting away from us the old Russian satellite becomes smaller and smaller.  We PAN with it as we SEE it's on a collision course with something huge. Suddenly the satellite EXPLODES on IMPACT with the much l object that dwarfs the puny piece of hardware.  As huge a is, we get the feeling we've only seen a portion of the t

dialogues.speaker: NEW YORK SKYLINE
dialogues.text: A slow crane down from the Manhattan skyline, revealing..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the New York skyline across the Hudson behind them, men sit in this small park playing chess.  Unlike the oth DAVID MARTIN is in his early thirties, sixties hippie mee nineties yuppie nerd. He concentrates intensely on his next move.  MOISHE. sixt smokes a cigar impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting?  My social security will expire, you'll still be sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So think already. David makes a move.  Instantly Moishe counters his move. David furls his brow in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again he's thinking. Moishe reaches into a paper bag and retrieves a coffee in Styrofoam cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have any idea how long it takes for those things to decompose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't move soon.  I'll begin to decompose. Just as David finally makes his move, Moishe counters aga David shoots him a look and stares back down to the board MOISHE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, I've been meaning to talk with you.  It's nice you've been spending so much time with me, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, don't start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only saying, it's been what? Four years, you still haven't signed your divorce papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three, four.  Move on.  It's not healthy. Moishe takes a big puff on the cigar and coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's talking healthy. Suddenly David's beeper goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times is that now?  You trying to get fired? David moves his queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checkmate.  See you tomorrow, Dad. He gives his father a quick kiss and hurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not checkmate I can still... Oh. (yelling after him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could let an old man win once in a while, it wouldn't kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David pedals his bike through mid-town Manhattan.  He arr at COMPACT CABLE SYSTEMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His bike hoisted on his shoulder, David squeezes through revolving doors. MARTY GILBERT, short, nervous and harrie comes rushing over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is the point of having a beeper if you don't turn it on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was turned on.  I was ignoring you.  What's the big emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Started this morning.  Every channel is making like it's nineteen fifty.  Snow, static, all kinds of distortions.  No one knows what the hell is going on. David deposits his bike in the kitchenette as Marty tosse coke bottle in the trash.  David retrieves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Marty.  There's a reason we have bins labeled "recycle." Finding more bottles in the trash, David turns to Marty accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So sue me. Before David can say anything, Marty ushers him out of th room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technicians are working feverishly.  Clearly every monito experiencing varying degrees of signal disruption.  David moves over to the main console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you try to switch to transponder channels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, would I be this panicked if it was that simple? David examines the readouts, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's retrofit the dish to another satellite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've tried.  It's not working. It's almost as though they  weren't even there. David looks up, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: A TELEVISION SET
dialogues.text: Bad reception.  A hand SMOCKS the side of it.  No use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven-year-old TROY BRENNON tries to fix the television. His older brother MIGUEL, seventeen, cooks breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all fuzzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna break it.  Just leave it alone.  Here, take your medicine. Miguel sits a small bottle of medicine and a spoon down i front of Troy.  Troy pushes the bottle away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing it back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take it, dick head. (turning to his sister)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alicia!  Make sure he takes his medicine. His sister, ALICIA, fourteen, hormones kicking in, testin boundaries, listens to her walkman while putting on too m makeup.  Miguel throws a dish towel to get her as Troy hi the television again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat up pick-up truck comes down a dirt road and skids halt on the gravel next to the Brennon Mobile Home at thi small shabby countryside trailer park.  An angry FARMER j out, slamming his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alicia opens the front door and smiles flirtatiously at t angry farmers, LUCAS, who marches over.  Miguel edges her of the doorway, wanting to handle this himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Lucas. Lucas holds a bowl full of rotted vegetables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like these!  I've got a whole goddamned crop full! Unceremoniously, he dumps them at Miguel's feet. LUCAS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is your father? You know what time it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to re-fuel.  There musta been a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both know what the problem is. He's a damned nut case, is what he is.  I musta been out of my mind. Troy SMACKS the television again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy, stop it!  I swear to God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel, if he's not in the air in twenty minutes, that's it.  I'm getting someone else. Lucas storms away.  Again, Troy whacks at the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Troy!  I swear to God! Determined, Troy HITS the television again.  This time th picture goes out completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling over us, the immense under-belly of this enormous craft obliterates our view.  A loud SCREECH.  Suddenly th bottom begins to SEGMENT. Dozens of large sections begins to DISENGAGE, extracting themselves, twisting away from the larger bilge. The separated SEGMENTS themselves are enormous.  Slowly t twist downwards on a collision course to the blue planet below... Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a barrage of questions from her own staff, Constanc hurries down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CNN is running a story that we're covering up some kind of nuclear testing experiments...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them to run with it if they want to embarrass themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NASA has been up my butt all morning.  They want to know our position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our official position is we don't have an official position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie, what the hell is going on? Constance escapes into the elevator, turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles confidently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, people.  Would I keep you guys out of the loop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a second!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Before she can retort, the elevator doors close.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: The President, General Grey, the SECRETARY OF DEFENSE and White House Chief of Staff ALBERT NIMZIKI are gathered ar the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the moment, our satellites are somewhat unreliable.  Isn't it possible that thing may just pass us by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it doesn't "pass us by?" Let's retarget some ICBMs to blow it out of the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, but with the little information we do have, the only thing that would accomplish is turn one dangerous falling object into many. Just then the door opens and Constance enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the damage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press is making up their own stories at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to General Grey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the horn with Atlantic Command.  Let's upgrade the situation to DEFCON 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not your call to make, Mr. Nimziki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that a little premature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're two days away from the fourth  of July.  We have over fifty percent  of our armed forces on weekend leave,  not to mention the troops and  commanders we        have in town for the  Fourth of July        parade.  We call them  back now, we're sending up a major red  flag. They go quiet as Commanding Officer from Space Command da into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our intelligence tells us the object has settled into a stationary orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. He lays out the diagrams and photos on the table.  Everyo gathers around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of it has broken off into nearly three dozen other pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pieces?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smaller than the whole, yet over fifteen miles in width themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they heading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should be entering our atmosphere within the next twenty- five minutes. The room is silenced.  All eyes turn to the President who nothing.  Nimziki leans in close to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it or not, we're at DEFCON 3. Recall the troops and put them on yellow alert.

dialogues.speaker: YELLOW LIGHTS FLASHING ON
dialogues.text: as an ALARM quickly BUZZES. David leans into frame and op the door to the microwave.  We WIDEN to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David retrieves his home-make cup-a-soup.  We SEE this cu clearly has the David touch; ecology posters, plants, ton computers and electronic gizmos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, tell me you're getting something. Marty enters, looking over David's shoulder as he eats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's good news and bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the bad news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in meal penalty for disturbing my lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the good news is you won't charge me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  The good news is I found the problem and it's not our equipment.  There's some weird signal embedded within the satellite feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the good news? David slides over to another computer and turns on an intricate computation program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, because the analog signal has a definite sequential digital patterns embedded within it.  When I find the exact binary sequence and I apply a phase reversed signal to that calculated spectra analyzer I built you last Christmas, we should be able to block out the overlay completely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and we'll be the only guys in town with a clear picture?  That's my man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing over back roads behind a long open field, Miguel r his beat-up motor bike, searching.  Looking up he SEES something in the air.

dialogues.speaker: AN OLD BI-WING AIRPLANE
dialogues.text: converted into a crop-duster, BUZZES overhead.  Spraying insecticide wildly, the plane zigzags over the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell!  God damn it, Russell! Looking down from the cockpit, RUSSELL BRENNON waves stup Shaggy blonde hair and two days' growth, Russell is the i of a fifty-one-year-old little boy. Miguel follows him below, screaming at him.  Russell, fly recklessly, looks down at Miguel not understanding.  By t time he looks back he SEES...

dialogues.speaker: A LINE OF TREES
dialogues.text: at the edge of the field, nearly on top of him.  In a tri move, Russell turns the plane on ITS SIDE, and SLICES thr the narrow gap between the trees. Miguel screams with delight at his prowess.  Miguel looks pissed.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SIDE OF TREES
dialogues.text: Miguel races over, skidding to a halt next to the landed with plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what the hell do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (climbing down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bringing home the bacon. Earning my keep.  And doing a fine job if I do say so myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the wrong field, you idiot! Lucas' farm is on the other side of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, he was doing you a favor. You know how hard it is to find someone who doesn't think you're completely crazy? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we supposed to do now? Huh?  Where are we supposed to go now? Pissed, Miguel peels away, kicking gravel back at Russell Pathetically, he reaches into his jacket and pulls out a bottle of Jack Daniels.  He takes a healthy swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tent city.  Ubiquitous overcrowding and poverty.  Sever hundred refugees settle down for the night. Super: Northern Desert, Iraq A BEDOUIN stokes a small fire besides his family's tent. Suddenly a group of shouting SCREAMING TRIBES PEOPLE come rushing past him. The Bedouin watches them with confusion.  Overcome with curiosity he goes against the tide of people, up the hill As the Bedouin reaches the top of the hillside, his mouth falls open, aghast as he SEES...

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIES
dialogues.text: Creeping from across the horizon above the rocky mountain terrain, a wide FIREBALL high in the sky, flaring and exploding.  A terrifying sight.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Super: Battle Carrier, USS Eisenhower - Persian Gulf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud KLAXON ALARM is ringing out.  The FIRST LIEUTENANT comes rushing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ensign, status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a total radar black out over a thirteen kilometer area. The Lieutenant moves over to the main radar screen.  The entire upper portion of the screen is BLANK.  And the bla area is MOVING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a complete diagnostic run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me sir, radar may be malfunctioning but infrared is off the map! He diverts the Lieutenant's attention to another screen; BRIGHT SEA OF RED light bleeds off the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the CINC Atlantic Command on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A technical OFFICER rips off a data sheet as it shoots ou the printer and rushes over to the Commanding Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we now have visual range with incoming over Iraqi airspace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second sighting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Sir, this just came in from the Eisenhower. The Commanding Officer grabs a phone laying off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correction, we have two confirmed visual contacts.  One over Iraq, one over the Pacific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is packed.  The President and his chief advisors there along with the Joint Chief of Staff.  Representativ from the Atlantic Command and U.S. Space Command have for small clusters around telephones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where in the Pacific? (turning to the President)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've spotted one off the California coast line. Surrounded by the Secret Service, the President is speech Constance Halbrook comes rushing into the room and whispe the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on. Constance moves over to a cabinet and turns on the T.V. ( reception is still fuzzy, picture "rolling").  The CNN Ne broadcast shows the phenomenon over Novosibirsk, Russia. There is mass hysteria behind the reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sightings of this atmospheric phenomenon have been reported here in Novosibirsk, Russia and other parts of Siberia.  Moving too slowly to be a comet or meteor, astronomers are baffled as to its origin... Everyone is locked onto the television, mesmerized. NEWSCASTERS (cont'd) (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Widespread panic has gripped the countryside as thousands have taken to the streets and clogged the highways.  Hundreds have been injured... General Grey confers with the Atlantic command CINC.  He turns to the President and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, we have an AWAC on the west coast.  E.T.A. with contact point, three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wall to wall computer, radar and intelligence gathering equipment.  Technicians frantically try to adjust as the system goes hay wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reporting into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no use.  Side radar doesn't see a thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reporting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's correct.  We're IMC blind, sir. We TRACK across them over to the pilots and into the cock Cloudy skies.  The PILOT squints out the window as he spe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative.  We still have zero visibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOOMING overhead as we SEE the AWAC sailing through a thi cloudy sky. Super:  Pacific Coastline, California The AWAC disappears from view into the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President and his top advisors are gathered around a speaker phone listening to the pilot of the AWAC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instrumentation is malfunctioning. We can't get any kind of reading on what's in front of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot squints as he tries to see through the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, it may be clearing. Suddenly the clouds part before us and we're face to face a WALL OF FLAMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speaker phone cracks and distorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus God!  The sky's on fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AWAC attempts to climb sharply as we get our first re look at the atmospheric phenomenon.  Majestic and monstro The AWAC is not going to be able to make it. Quickly it is ENGULFED in the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone line goes dead.  General Grey spins to an AIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them back on line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on other phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Line's gone, sir. The ATLANTIC COMMAND CINC, turns from a different phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more have been spotted over the Atlantic.  One is moving toward New York, the other is headed this direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Less than ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to aid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Organize a military escort to Crystal Mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to President)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I strongly recommend we move you to a secured location immediately. ... The President hesitates, he turns to Constance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we expect the same kid of panic here as in Russia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than likely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, you can discuss this on the way. Torn, the President grapples with a decision.  Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must maintain a working government in a time of crisis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the Vice President, Secretary of Defense, the whole Cabinet and the Joint Chiefs taken to a secured location. I'm staying here.  I am not going to add to a public hysteria that could cost lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Mr. President...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far these things have not become hostile.  For the moment let's assume they won't. (to Constance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie, let's issue statements advising people not to panic, to stay home and take cover. Constance issues commands to her staff as they quickly exit along with most people in the room.  General Grey go over to the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your permission, Mr. President, I'd like to remain my your side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a feeling you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, what happens if they do become hostile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then God help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the T.V. behind David, news footage of the phenomenon Russia plays silently.  Oblivious, David works his comput

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping in doorway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, are you watching this? David waves her away, deep in concentration.  Suddenly a computer BEEPS.  Excitedly David prints out his finding. grabs it and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engrossed in his printout, David walks past his co-worker are glued to the distorted picture on the television, wat the phenomenon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty stares at his television watching General Grey addressing the press.  David enters, staring at his readi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a lock on the signal pattern.  We can filter it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  Oh, good, hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange thing is, if my calculations are right it'll be gone in approximately seven hours anyway.  The signal reduces itself every time it recycles. Eventually it will disappear.  Are you listening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still glued to T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What re you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you been watching? David turns for the first time to the television and sees phenomenon.  Constance comes on addressing the press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so far the phenomenon has not caused any damage.  In all likelihood it won't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More reporters rush in from the back quickly setting up a this hastily called press conference continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...everyone should remain calm. Take cover where you can but the important thing is not to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel, Alicia and Troy watch the static riddled T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) ...we have a fix on three

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: different occurrences about to appear over American cities.  One is headed toward Los Angeles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the other two are on our Eastern seaboard headed towards New York and Washington, D.C... Suddenly hectic CO-WORKER #2 appear at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie says this building has an old bomb shelter.  We're heading down there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry; to David)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel no shame in hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of people head down the hall for the shelter whil others stay glued to the set.  There is a mix of fascinat and panic.  David watches the commotion, dumb struck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, I better call my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depressed Russell nurses a beer at the counter.  Three FL MECHANICS walk in, having a good laugh.  One of them spot Russell and moves over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Russ, heard you had a little trouble this morning.  Dusted the wrong field? The Mechanics laugh.  Russell tries to ignore them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, you're probably still a little confused from your hostage experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hostage experience?  Something happen to you, Russ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't never told you!?  Seems years back our boy here had been kidnapped by aliens.  Did all kinds of experiments on him and such.  Tell him, Russ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today, guys.  Okay. Russell gets up and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just gotta get a couple more beers in him, he'll tell you all about it.  Crazy stuff.  Won't you, Russ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mechanic follows Russell outside, his buddies in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Russ, when they took you up in their space ship, they do any sexual things to you? The mechanics crack up laughing.  Suddenly the things aro them begin to RUMBLE.  The SHADOW engulfs them, silencing Mechanics. Panicked they turn and RUN AWAY.  Russell just looks up a sky, grabs his Jack Daniels and takes another swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs bark and people stumble out of their trailers as an enormous SHADOW creeps over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows grow DARK and the room begins to RUMBLE.  Mig rushes to the door, ushering his siblings out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alicia and Troy step out the door, stopping dead in their tracks.  Miguel follows them only to look up and SEE...

dialogues.speaker: THE PHENOMENON
dialogues.text: The flames are burning out, replaced by huge plumes of da smoke billowing around the edges of the phenomena.  Only traces of extinguishing flames illuminate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David pushes past the people making their way down, fight against the tide.  Another CO-WORKER (#3) stops halfway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you coming, David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, I've got to see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightened tourists run for cover as the colossal SHADOW approaches.  Reflected in the water below we SEE the fier apparition transfigure into the dark foreboding clouds.

dialogues.speaker: THE LINCOLN MEMORIAL
dialogues.text: The SHADOW writhes up the detailed statue of Lincoln, devouring him completely until we are left in total darkn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are being evacuated from their offices.  Patricia, President's daughter, breaks away from her nanny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President talks on the phone.  Constance waits nearby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Russia and the United States are in this together.  Yes, Mr. President, you have my word. Yes, Das Vedanya. The President hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is their position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he was drunk. Patricia bursts through the door and runs into her father arms, terrified.  A SECRET SERVICE man appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, we have to go. Abruptly, the room DARKENS as it begins to RUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The long, dark SHADOW moves across the entire White House engulfing it in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance we SEE the mutated phenomenon's dark gray clouds nearing Miss. Liberty.  As it approaches we SEE th York skyline begin to darken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids playing basket ball.  A young BOY stops playing, sta skyward.  One by one, they all look upwards, stunned as a dark SHADOW creeps over them. With a loud CRASH, several New York Cabs SLAM into one an in the street.  Two more cars crash into them.  A pile up ensues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foot traffic stops as the long SHADOW crawls over the ent area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large satellite dishes beset a doorway to the roof which open.  David steps out just as a long, dark SHADOW covers him, sending the city into darkness.  David looks up to S

dialogues.speaker: SKYLINE AND ALIEN CRAFT
dialogues.text: Protruding through the dark clouds we get a glimpse of th underbelly of a colossal ALIEN CRAFT, its outer veneer of smoke and clouds beginning to fade away. Below we see PANIC, cabs SLAMMING into one another, peopl staring, people screaming.  No one knows how to react. David runs to the other side of the rooftop, overlooking Central Park, to get a better look.

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL PARK
dialogues.text: The entire park is plunged into darkness as the craft abo blots out of the sun.  Amazing as it may seem, the hoveri BLANKETS THE ENTIRE PARK and BEYOND.  We still have NOT s an entire craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.  The signal.

dialogues.speaker: LATER MORNING
dialogues.text: A panoramic view of the Los Angeles basin.  Slowly fillin screen, we SEE a portion of the enormous space craft as i creeps towards the city, obliterating our view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A station wagon, filled with kids and a harried HOUSEWIFE comes to a stop.  The passenger door opens and a young si year-old boy, DYLAN steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, tell your mom you can stay overnight again Thursday. Suddenly a car SAILS over a nearby hill in front of them, hitting the ground with a BANG.  Two more cars follows, a bound.  As the Housewife turns she SEES...

dialogues.speaker: SPACE SHIP
dialogues.text: Rising over the mountain we SEE the Space Ship as it near city, blocking out the sunshine. Panicked, the Housewife hits the gas and peels out, leavi confused Dylan staring skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two people sleep as Dylan runs into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, look at! He rushes away.  The SHADOW moves past the window, darken the room.  His mother, JASMINE DUBROW, stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: darkness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too early, baby. She turns back over.  Suddenly the room briefly RUMBLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earthquake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even a four pointer.  Go back to sleep. Shrugging, the man does.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLYWOOD SIGN, (FORMERLY SC. 72)
dialogues.text: In Los Angeles.  The SHADOW slowly covers the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President and his daughter cautiously approach the wi staring in awe at the amazing sight above them.  Several others approach from behind. Cautiously some people begin to walk outside, staring up the leviathan, mouths agape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly staff members approach, gazing out the window. Constance steps up behind the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Address the nation.  There are a lot of very frightened people out there right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I'm one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of Washington is under the shadow of this gargantuan craft.  A stunning tableau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man sleeping next to Jasmine's beagle BOOMER drops Steven's tennis shoes on top of him, waking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to impress you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing a good job. He pats the dog on the head and takes the shoes.  Steven up and makes his way to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Steve takes a pee, he SEES out the window a family pac up their car, others standing around staring at something the distance.  A HELICOPTER flies overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neighbors are moving.  I think they're tired of earthquakes. He finished and flushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve enters the living room.  The television is playing news broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with little damage reported to the southland area.  People are advised not to panic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hon, something's on the table 'bout the quake. Jasmine sits up in bed, yelling out to Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan out there? Steve turns, looking for Dylan when the doggie door pops and Dylan crawls through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you been up to, Sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding his gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting aliens. Steve musses up the boy's hair, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (entering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee? Steve mumbles an affirmative as he exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve picks up the morning paper and opens it.  He doesn' notice the DOZENS of neighbors quickly packing up and rus to get away as he reads the paper oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want milk with your coffee? Jasmine appears behind him, her view, too, obscured by th open newspaper.  Suddenly another HELICOPTER room overhea Annoyed, Steve lowers his paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the paper is lowered we SEE the helicopter SWOOP down. it flies away we SEE...

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN CRAFT
dialogues.text: Covering all of Los Angeles.  This is the first time we s the entire craft.  It is stupendous.  Steve's jaw hits th floor.  The milk goes CRASHING as Jasmine SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running for all he's worth, David sprints down the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dashing off the stairs, David stops seeing that the room now completely empty.  The wall of monitors play for no o David walks up to one, adjusting the volume.

dialogues.speaker: T.V.
dialogues.text: A space ship logo spins next to the words VISITORS: CONTA CRISIS.  Wolf Blitzer comes on screen live from the Penta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pentagon officials are reporting more ships have just arrived over the capitals of India, England and Germany. As he speaks we get quick glimpses of the other ships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, babycakes.  Calm down. David spins around at the sound of the voice but the room still empty.  David leans down and looks under a desk whe finds Marty still on the phone with his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her to get the kids and leave town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it! Marty realizes David is dead serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babycakes, pack the kids up and take them to your mother's.  Don't ask.  Go. Mary hangs up, crawls out from under the table. MARTY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, why did I just send my family to Atlanta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember I told you that the signal hidden within our satellite signal is slowly recycling down to extinction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That signal.  It's a countdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A countdown to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think.  It's like in chess.  First you strategically position your pieces.  Then, when the timing's right.  You strike. David motions to the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there are additional unconfirmed sightings over Japan, the Mediterranean, and China...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are positioning themselves all over the world and using this one signal to synchronize their efforts.  In approximately six hours the signal will disappear and the countdown will be over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checkmate. Marty takes a beat to digest.  Then, grabbing the phone..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta call my brother, my bookie, my lawyer... fuck my lawyer... David also grabs a phone.  Suddenly the bank of monitors synchronize into one enormous image across the entire vid wall; the President addressing the nation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President stands at the podium giving his address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fellow Americans, a historic and unprecedented event has taken place.  The question as to whether or not we are alone in the universe has been answered...

dialogues.speaker: SIDE ENTRANCE TO PRESS ROOM
dialogues.text: As Constance watches the President, she unconsciously mou the words of his speech, after all, she did write them. PRESS AIDE tugs on her sleeve.  She tries to wave her off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he's your husband. Her expression drops.  She takes the phone from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to leave the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not the time or the place to have this same old discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.  You have to leave Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impatient, Constance tries to get off the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case you haven't noticed, we're in a little bit of a crisis here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've worked with embedded loading. They're communicating with a hidden signal.  They're going to attack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not paranoia.  The embedding is very subtle.  It's probably been overlooked... Constance hangs up.  Her face betrays mixed emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David stares at the phone, pissed.  Something on T.V. catches his attention.  Through the snowy image he SEES..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My staff and I are remaining here at the White House while we attempt to establish communication... Hanging up the phone, David sprints for the exit. PRESIDENT WHITMORE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so remain calm.  If you are compelled to leave these cities, please do so in a safe and orderly fashion.

dialogues.speaker: CABS SLAMMING TOGETHER
dialogues.text: The rush to get away creeps slowly as cars jam the street total grid-lock.  David pedals his bike furiously through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mass exodus has reached the bridge.  Total congestion David fights his way through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The New York skyline behind him across the Hudson, David off his bike, and races towards a row of tract houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David BANGS on the door.  It flies open.  Moishe is holdi hunting rifle, pointing it at David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television said they've started with the looting already Vultures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still got the Olds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to borrow the car?  You don't have a license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.  You're driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, wearing his Marine flight officer uniform, shoves last of his things into his duffel bag.  We notice there small figurines of dolphins everywhere.  Jasmine hovers nervously behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go.  Call them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, you know how it is.  I have to report to El Toro right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you were on leave for the Fourth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cancelled it.  Why are you acting like this? Jasmine grabs the blinds and yanks them away.  We SEE the alien craft through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  That's why.  That thing scares the piss out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan sits behind the wheel pretending to drive.  Steve g him, pulling him out.  He reaches into his duffel, grabs brown paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  I got these for you.  Be careful with them. Dylan opens the bag; fireworks.  Jasmine walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Steve tosses his gear into the back, opens his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  I have to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loses her nerve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, after your shift tonight, why don't you grab Dylan and come stay with me on base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  You don't mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw.  I'll just tell my other girlfriends they can't come over tonight. Pissed, she hits him.  He loves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're not as charming as you think you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick-weed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butt-munch. They kiss.  Steve hops into his car and peels out.  Jasmi takes the bag from Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommmmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfectly preserved '68 Olds drives cautiously down the highway.  Around him we see other cars packed to the gill they make their escape from New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the most confident driver, Moishe holds the steering close to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the White House, for crying out loud.  You can't just drive up and ring the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't this thing go any faster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they don't know what you know?  Believe me, they know.  She works for the President.  They know everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're going to educate them? Tell me something, you're so smart how come you spent eight years at M.I.T. to become a cable repairman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is they've got people who handle these things, David.  They want HBO, they'll call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Whitmore is at a house phone.  Behind her we see sev news crews waiting for interviews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered through phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're staying there to keep people calm.  It's the right thing to do.  I'm not going to let them criticize you for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President sits on his bed, his daughter lays next to watching T.V.  The signal distortion is getting worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine but the second your interviews are done, I have a helicopter ready to take you to Nellis Air Force...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the munchkin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's glued to the T.V., just like the rest of the world.  I love you too.  Here she is... He hands Patty the phone as General Grey and Nimziki appe the doorway.  The President walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More ships keep arriving, fifteen in total so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy.  We're loosing our first strike capabilities!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying to communicate with them on all frequencies but we're getting nowhere.  Atlantic Command is working on a type of visual communication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are they up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long crowded highway of people trying to escape from Lo Angeles can be seen in the distance.  The huge space craf hovering behind them. Miguel is on the roof of the trailer, adjusting the T.V. antenna trying to get a picture.  Suddenly the image clea and we SEE a group of people in a crowded hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a local crop duster was arrested today attempting to land at Edwards Air Force Base... On the T.V. we SEE Russell being escorted to a police car Mortified, Miguel can't believe what he's seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got to do something. I was abducted by space aliens ten years ago.  They did all kinds of experiments on me.  They've been studying us for years, learning our weakness.  We've go to do something before they kill us all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Troy starts to climb up, Miguel changes the chann Mrs. Whitmore.  Troy sits down next to Miguel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we need to remain calm.  As more people decide to leave the cities, safety is key...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy, you remember Uncle Hector, from Tucson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got that SEGA Saturn CD, 64 bit, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  What would you think if we went there to live for a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be cool! Miguel thinks for a second, makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pack up, we're going. Miguel jumps down from the roof.  Troy climbs down the la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling after him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Dad?

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA AND OLDER BOY
dialogues.text: Kissing.  It's getting hot.  Alicia laughs, pushes him aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could be our last night on Earth.  You don't want to die a virgin, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think I'm a virgin? The Older Boy is taken off guard.  Before he can answer t tarp they were hiding under is ripped away.  Miguel stand there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere... Miguel grabs her by the wrist and pulls her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the long highway leading to Washington, the space hovering above it.  One side of the freeway is packed sol the other completely empty, save for one car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moishe looks to the other side of the freeway, jam packed his side, they are the only car for miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole world is trying to get out of Washington and we're the only schmucks trying to get in. As Moishe drives, David distracts him as he unpacks his backpack unloading his laptop.  He grabs a CD. MOISHE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This, pops, is every phone book in America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think an important person like Constance is going to be listed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She always keeps her portable phone listed, for emergencies. Sometimes it's just her first initial, sometime her nickname... David starts to look it up.  Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: DOZENS OF CARS HEADING STRAIGHT FOR THEM
dialogues.text: In the attempt to get out, hundreds of cars have been re- directed by the military to use the opposite side of the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Moishe SWERVES violently to avoid collision, barely missi the oncoming traffic.  Dodging right to left, Moishe hang for dear life. A Military Office, assisting in diverting the cars turns in time to see the Olds whiz by. David and Moishe are bounded around the inside of the car Moishe tries to veer through traffic. Suddenly A TRUCK  blocks off their only escape route. Moishe turns HARD and drives up onto the right shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: OLDS AND TRAFFIC
dialogues.text: The Olds is the only car in headed that direction.  Using shoulder, swerving to miss barricades, they drives off an ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice driving, pops! Dangerously close to a heart attack, Moishe is, for once, loss for words.  Over their adrenaline pumped faces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...put your hands together for Sabrina!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bikini-clad Sabrina twirls gracefully on the stage.  As comes to a stop we reveal Sabrina is actually Jasmine.  S looks out into the audience and her expression DROPS.

dialogues.speaker: JASMINE'S POV
dialogues.text: Five strippers and eight customers.  All crowded near the television watching the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helicopter footage of people gathered on the rooftops of downtown Los Angeles holding up drawings of space aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...from the "it could only happen in California" file, hundreds of UFO fanatics have gathered on the rooftops of downtown Los Angeles, welcoming the new arrivals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jasmine storms into the dressing room.  Wiping off her ma she sits down next to TIFFANY who watches the same report small b&w.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I even came in tonight.  What was I thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this cool?  And you thought I was nuts.  Oh, look, I brought mine with me. Tiffany holds up a drawing of a space alien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not thinking of joining those idiots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going over there soon as I'm off.  Wanna come? Jasmine turns to Tiffany, dead serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiffany, I don't want you to go up there.  Promise me you won't. (Tiffany pouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I'm gone.  I'm outta town for a while. Her boss MARIO enters and walks over to his private offic back.  He opens the door and finds Dylan playing with his Boomer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's your kid doing here? Jasmine rushes past picking up Dylan and carrying him awa she heads for the exit.  Boomer follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try to find a sitter today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think you're going? You leave, you're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice working with you, Mario.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are nearly deserted.  Millions of small light the underbelly of the craft cast strange reflections on t streets below.  The Olds drives on its way towards the Ca building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David types frustratedly on his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not listed, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just haven't found it yet.  I tried C. Halbrook, Connie Halbrook, Spunky Halbrook...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spunky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College nickname.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try Martin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't take my name when we were married. Moishe shrugs.  David gives it a shot.  Finds it.  The ma BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded locker room.  Steve enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, were you guys waiting for me? Several Marines throws towels at Steve as he makes his wa his locker.  His best friend, JIMMY, sits next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe it?  This is serious shit, Stevie.  They've recalled everyone! As Steve sits he SEES some envelops stuck into the side o locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the mail's still working. He flips through the envelops and FREEZES when he sees on with the NASA insignia on it.  Jimmy snatches it away fro him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junk mail.  You don't want this. Steve quickly snatches it back, right it open and reads. the disappointment on his face we can tell it's bad news. Realizing, Jimmy puts a hand on Steve's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.  They make you learn how to fly everything from an Apache to a Harrier and still they turn you down?  What else do they want you to learn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How to kiss ass. Steve crumples at the letter and tosses it.  Angrily he o locker.  Pasted on the locker door we see photos of Jasmi next to the photos of the space shuttle, Apollo Missions, NASA insignia bumper sticker. As Steve stuffs his jacket into the locker, something fal out.  Before Steve can grab it, Jimmy snatches it up firs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jasmine has this thing for dolphins.  I had them make it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said you were doing to break it off. Steve snatches it back, embarrassed. JIMMY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, listen to me, you're never gonna get to fly the space shuttle if you marry a stripper. Steve knows he's right.  He's torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Olds stops near the White House.  From here we can SE tanks and armed patrols.  A small group of protesters hav gathered, upset about the military hardware.  Signs: "Don provoke" "Violence begets Violence."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David adjusts a small portable satellite, connecting it t phon and laptop computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you want to ring the bell or  should I? David flips open the phone, dials the number on the scree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect, she's using it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfect the line is busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I can use he signal to triangulate her exact position in the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do that? Shooting his father a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All cable repairmen can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constance is just finishing a call on her cellular phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sally, take my cat with when you leave.  No I'm staying here at the White House.  Take care. The moment she hangs up, it RINGS.  Surprised, she answer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie, don't hang up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David?  How'd you get this number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk to the window.  Right in front of you. Constance looks up to the large glass windows.  She walks to it, looking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I looking for?

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Between two of the tanks outside, Constance can SEE David standing on top of the Olds across the street.  Moishe st out, waves.  Constance is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does he do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulking, Alicia sits in back with he walkman on.  Troy sl while Miguel drives.  Suddenly Miguel his the brakes, as something comes SAILING DOWN FROM THE SKY. We realize it's the B-WING PLANE landing on the stretch o roadway directly in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane lands, skids into a turn.  Russell jumps out, w over to the trailer.  We can tell he's drunk again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They let you out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what the hell do you think you're doing? Miguel moves to meet Russell away from the trailer, not wanting the others to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're leaving, don't try and stop us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere.  You hear me?  I'm still your father. Miguel explodes, this has been building up for some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not!  You're just the man who married my mother.  You're nothing to me! Russell is momentarily silent, stunned.  Recovering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy's still my son no matter how you feel about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For once in your life think about what's best for Troy.  Who has to beg for money to buy him medicine when you screw up?  Who? Suddenly we hear glass CRASHING.  Both men spin to find T standing behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  I'm not a baby!  I don't need your stupid medicine.  I don't need anyone to take care of me! Miguel leans down to see the broken MEDICINE BOTTLE on th floor.  Miguel rushes over to him, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what this stuff costs? Do you want to get sick again!? Do you!? Frustrated, Miguel shoves Troy aside and heads back into trailer.  Wobbly from the drinking, Russell stands there pathetically, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large group of press rush over toward FOUR APACHE HELICOPTERS, each refitted with a large LIGHT BOARDS, as slowly lift off the ground.  Cameras flash, reporters yel questions to the Officers assigned to keep them at bay. Several news organizations do stand up remotes.  We TRACK them to the CNN crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you see behind me are four Apache helicopters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the television plays the CNN broadcast.  The reception intermittently disrupted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered through T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...each has been refitted with what Pentagon officially hope will be our first step in communicating with the alien craft... We WIDEN to reveal a large contingent of military personn along with the President's chief advisors gathered around several monitors, (the center monitors are momentarily bl Suddenly everyone snaps to attention as the President ent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moishe inspects a photo of Constance with the President, impressed he nods with approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice. Constance is looking at David's laptop displaying the breakdown of the alien signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when is the countdown supposed to expire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty six minutes, forty five seconds. Constance runs her fingers through her hair, exasperated. Moishe turns, listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to leave with us. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave.  We have to tell this to the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going to listen to me. Surprised at his son, Moishe steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure he'll listen.  Why wouldn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because last time I saw him I punched him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You punched the President in the face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't the President then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David thought I was having an affair, which I wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Punched the President?  Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: APACHE HELICOPTERS
dialogues.text: ZOOM by overhead.  In the distance we see they are headed the enormous alien craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT adjusts his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Echo one, we are closing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choppers alter their formation, aligning themselves alongside one another.  As the helicopters near the craft see how tiny they appear against the gargantuan space shi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open and Moishe steps out, overwhelmed impressed.  Constance leads them down the hall.  Moishe t to David, whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had known I was going to meet the President, I'd a worn a tie. Look at me, I look like a  schlemiel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Office is empty as the trio walks in.  Moishe can't believe he's in there.  He straightens himself up, combs hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here.  I'll be right back. David sets up his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The middle monitors are now on.  They show the night visi P.O.V. of the helicopters as they approach.  On the side monitors we SEE the various news broadcast of this event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the helicopters are making their final approach... On the middle monitor, through the night vision camera on lead helicopter we SEE the side of the craft as the helicopters near. Everyone in the room watches, tense. Constance enters and kneels down next to the President, whispering in his ear.  The President gets up and follows Constance.  Chief of Staff Nimziki objects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving now? The President silences him with a look.  As they exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you put up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used to run the NASA.  He knows where all the bones are buried. Comes in handy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open and Constance and the President enter The moment President Whitmore sees David, he freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's he doing here? Moishe, bursting, steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moishe Martinsburg, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ex-husband works in satellite communications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time for this... With a BANG, David suddenly KNOCKS everything off the President's desk and starts to draw on the ink blotter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about "Line o sight," Mr. President... David draws a circle representing Earth and a smaller cir just away from it.  The President reluctantly nears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...If you wanted t coordinate with ships all over the world, you couldn't send one signal to every place at the same time.  That's called line of sight... Drawing a line from the ship of either side of the Earth, SEE that you could not send a signal to the other side. DAVID (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you'd need to relay your signal using satellites... David draws small satellites surrounding Earth. DAVID (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to reach each ship.  I have found a signal hidden inside our own satellite network. Suddenly an aide, ALEX, appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. President.  They're starting. The President turns to the monitor in his office.  We SEE helicopters turning on the light boards affixed to the fr of their cockpits.  He turns back to David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, they are using our own satellites against us and the clock is ticking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large light panels TURN ON, multi-colored lights slow begins to flash in a repeating sequential patterns.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTERS AND SPACE CRAFT
dialogues.text: The helicopters are puny little specs next to this Goliat The light boards continues to FLASH but there is no react from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is glued to the monitors as the President storms

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Grey, co-ordinate with Atlantic Command.  Tell them they have twenty five minutes to get as many people out of the cities as they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mr. President...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
