dialogues.text: And get those helicopters away from the ship.  Call them back immediately. General Grey obeys, turning to an assistant who quickly g a phone.  Nimziki steps up to the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're leaving. An AIDE motions to the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're responding. The room goes silent, everyone turns to the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: On all screens we SEE the space ship as a long thin line WHITE LIGHT suddenly emits from the side of the craft, illuminating the four Apache Helicopters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light boards are overpowered by the bright light comi from the space craft.  Suddenly with a loud SCREECHING NO the white light spills out as the huge OPENING unfolds at side of the craft. The four helicopters have to flight to hold their positio something powerful emits from the schism in the ship. Then like a gigantic bug-zapper, the four pesky little Ap Helicopters are BLOWN OUT OF THE SKY, one by one.  They l no time to retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Whitmore packs her bag, as the horrifying image of t destruction of the helicopter replays on the T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Whitmore?  The President has ordered the evacuation.  We have to leave, now. She slams her valise SHUT and quickly exits.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: SOARS over us, headed directly for downtown Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The UFO true believers are still there, holding up their signs.  Making her way through several of them we see Tif She looks up to the spacecraft above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. She digs her drawing of an alien out of her purse as she excitedly rushes up to the others.  She holds it up to th sky, proudly.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: From out of nowhere the helicopter LIFTS up over the side the building, shining its spotlight down the believers below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we are evacuating the city. Please leave the building at once. The sign holders begin to "boo" the police, ignoring them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freeway is packed on both sides, every car headed out town.  There is no opposing traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan holds Boomers as Jasmine drives.  The news plays ov car radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...authorities have called for a complete evacuation of Los Angeles County.  People are advised to avoid the highways whenever possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he tells me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President stops on his way to the Presidential helico as an aide brings his daughter outside.  The President us her into the helicopter.  He turns back and see a militar guard holding back Moishe and David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're okay.  Let them on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President steps inside, turns to General Grey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is my wife in the air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She should be shortly. David flips open his laptop which reads: 09:07. 09:96...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Presidential helicopter lifts off as several other helicopters wait behind, people filing into them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police helicopter is still flashing their lights at t UFO believers who refuse to budge.  Suddenly the entire rooftop is BATHED IN WHITE LIGHT.  They all grow silent staring up at the craft. Above them another SCHISM has opened at the bottom of the craft, the white light spilling out. As though the heavens had opened, the UFO believers lift arms, waiting to be taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me!  No, take me!  Take me! Slowly, this beam of light from the base of the ship INTENSIFIES directly on the top of this building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing on this rooftop heliport directly across from th believers, the First Lady watches them, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling over helicopter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Whitmore! Reluctantly, the First Lady turns and runs for the helico The door is shut and the helicopter takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a ROAR, the Presidential helicopter ZOOMS past, behi we see an enormous SCHISM opening beneath the space craft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is helping people get onto the remaining helicopters Suddenly he is bathed in WHITE LIGHT.  He looks up and se the SCHISM, its WHITE BEAM coming directly down upon the House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pinnacle of this landmark is abruptly illuminated in LIGHT.  We PAN UP to the space craft above, the beam intensifying from the SCHISM below the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Presidential helicopter lands.  The President and his group are ushered over to AIR FORCE ONE which stands only hundred yard away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door OPENS and the President and his advisors rush in David flops down into a seat, quickly flips open his lapt which reads: 00:05, 00:04...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the light amplifies, the believers chant, louder and louder.  Suddenly the white light DISAPPEARS.  The believ are stunned.  In a brief moment it is replaced with a BLA A DESTRUCTION BEAM BLASTS down onto the rooftop, splinter everything there, Police helicopter included, into a bill tiny particles. Tiffany is he epicenter, from here the WALL OF DESTRUCTIO outwardly, destroying everything in its path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the BLAST HITS, the historic building is DECIMATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex shuts the door on a helicopter.  As he steps back th white light VANISHES.  He looks up as the BLAST replaces beam.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Just as one of the helicopters pass us, the White House SPLINTERS BEFORE OUR EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One quickly taxis down the runway toward us. Behind them in the distance we can SEE the DESTRUCTIVE be GROWING OUTWARDLY from the epicenter.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAPITOL BUILDING
dialogues.text: The WALL OF DESTRUCTION reaches the Capitol Building, fragmenting into a trillion particles.

dialogues.speaker: THE PENTAGON
dialogues.text: Washed under the WALL OF DESTRUCTION, the Pentagon, too, blown to smithereens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thick with tension.  Everyone is white-knuckled, anxious take off as they taxi quicky down the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force one, full throttle.  It LIFTS OFF just in time miss the WALL OF DESTRUCTION as it rips apart the airport behind them, dangerously close. WIDE ANGLES - WASHINGTON, D.C. We SEE the WAVE OF DESTRUCTION growing outwardly from the epicenter, ENGULFING ALL OF WASHINGTON. Air Force One is just barely making it out in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jasmine's car is caught in traffic just outside the tunne underpass at the Griffith Park Mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My God.  It's destroying everything in its path. Widening... Suddenly the radio CUTS OUT.  Jasmine turns around and SE

dialogues.speaker: FREEWAY
dialogues.text: Far off the devastation of downtown can be seen.  The WAL DESTRUCTION growing towards us. Reacting, Jasmine grabs Dylan and dashes out of the car. Boomer follows.  Every drivers who can, jumps out of thei cars, running in all directions. Jasmine heads for the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: FREEWAY
dialogues.text: The grid-locked cars have nowhere to run as the WALL OF DESTRUCTION grows out from downtown.  All the cars are WI OUT in a row, sitting ducks.

dialogues.speaker: OVERPASS
dialogues.text: Packed with cars.  They're quickly demolished as the WALL DESTRUCTION blasts by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jasmine turns back from the tunnel entrance.

dialogues.speaker: WALL OF DESTRUCTION
dialogues.text: Ever nearing, only moments away. Jasmine spots an open MAINTENANCE ALCOVE deep within the tunnel.  She runs to it, puts Dylan inside and climbs in him. Leaning back out, Jasmine looks for Boomer who stares at wagging his tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boomer, come.  Come boy! Boomer LEAPS inside and Jasmine ducks to the side of the OF DESTRUCTION hits the tunnel entrance, cars are JAMMED TOGETHER, SMASHING into one another. Suddenly the car ARE BLOWN CLEAR THROUGH THE TUNNEL like many toy Hot Wheel cars. Inside the Maintenance alcove, Jasmine shields Dylan and Boomer with her body.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: From a distance we WATCH as all of Manhattan is consumed its center outwardly by the growing WALL OF DESTRUCTION. Within seconds all of Manhattan is gone. The WALL OF DESTRUCTION reaches its outer most edges and away. The SCHISM under the craft slowly CLOSES.  The ship now h over a completely wiped out Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand adjusts the trailer radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...reports are unclear as to the extent of the devastation, but from all accounts, Los Angeles, Washington and New York have been left in ruins... Russell shoots a worried look over to Miguel.  Suddenly T moves up to the front on wobbly legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, I don't feel so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you had your medicine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four days... five? Troy looks really sick.  Miguel is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I gave you some this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't take it.  I thought I didn't need it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trailer, with Russell's Bi-wing in tow, pulls over. rushes out, vomiting on the side of the road.  Miguel com his aide.  Russell steps out and walks to the curve in th highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel?  Come take a look at this. Reluctantly Miguel leaves his brother's side.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSELL AND MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Below an entire valley filled with campers, trailers and busses.  An instant refugee city, if you will, for as far the eye can see.  Spectacular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five pilots are being briefed by their Commanding Office, CAPTAIN WATSON who points to a fuzzy photograph o the craft over Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be the first wave in our counter attack.  Though surveillance satellite reconnaissance has been impaired, we have a fix on our primary target. Steve and Jimmy sit next to each other near the back of t room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't exactly need radar to find it. Jimmy chuckles.  Watson is annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to add something to this briefing, Lt. Hill? Steve smiles confidently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Sir.  Just real anxious to kick some alien ass. Everyone chuckles, including Captain Watson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge hangar doors open revealing an F/A-18 HORNET, one of U.S.A.F.'s elite.

dialogues.speaker: TARMAC
dialogues.text: Thirty F/A-18s await take off on the tarmac as Technician Flight Crews race for position.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE BLAST
dialogues.text: The heat waves momentarily obscure our view as the F/A-18 take to the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President is deeply contemplative.  Constance sits do next to him.  She knows what he's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved a lot of lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have evacuated the cities hours ago. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, when I flew in the Gulf War everything is simple.  We knew what we had to do.  It's not simple anymore, Connie.  A lot of people died today.  How many didn't have to? Constance realizes there's no comforting him.  She suppor him silently by being there.  General Grey comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any news on my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter never arrived at Nellis and there's been no radio contact. The news rocks the President.  They both know what that m GENERAL GREY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fighters are in the air. Whitmore nods and follows the General to the back of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND CENTER
dialogues.text: Military Command has been set up on Air Force One, a kind flying NORAD.  Military and technical crew are seated at controls.  Nimziki is already there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All satellites, microwave and ground communications with the cities are gone.  We believe we're looking at a total loss. Maintaining his composure, the President looks up at the tracking screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ETA with target; four minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five F/A-18 fighters move into frame.  As we WIDEN we REV total of 30 F/A-18s in attack formation, destination Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve pulls a long cigar out of his breast pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy crack corn, do you have victory dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy pulls his cigar out.  Examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is an affirmative.  I have victory dance. Mmmmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get premature on me, Jimmy. We don't light up 'til the Fat Lady sings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air sick, David holds a "barf bag" as Moishe talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Air Force One for crying out loud.  Still he gets sick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moishe, please, don't talk. Moishe pats his belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, like a rock.  Good weather, bad, doesn't matter. (motions with his hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can go up and down, back and forth, side to side... David can't take any more of this story and takes off run for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I say? Constance comes over, sits next to Moishe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still gets air sick, huh?  In all of this I didn't get the chance to thank you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think nothing of it, Spanky. Constance smiles, corrects him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spunky.  He told you about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All he could think about was getting to you.  There's still love there I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love was never our problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you need is love.  John Lennon.  Smart man.  Shot in the back, very sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance we can see the devastated Los Angeles, th space craft still hovering above it.  The Fighters zoom i frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve looks down, becomes worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have left her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, big guy.  I'm sure she got out of here before it happened. Steve nods absently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's lock and load.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The center F/A-18 on the radar map begins to FLASH yellow just under its image.  We SEE a video display of its FLIR (forward-looking infrared) targeting system, locked on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Los Angeles attack squadron has AMRAAM missiles locked on target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washington and New York squadrons, reporting lock on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire at will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Advanced Medium-Range Air-to-Air Missile (AMRAAM) DROP down from the underbelly of the fighter, DARTING OFF. Radar targeted, the missile BANKS hard, adjusting.  We SE is joined by FOURTEEN other missiles, all rocketing towar their target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missiles are headed straight for the alien ship. Suddenly about a quarter mile before they reach it, they EXPLODE, as though blown out of the sky. When the smoke clears we see there has been zero damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even see them fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Command, Eagle One.  Switching to "sidewinders."  We're moving in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In unison these amazing birds DIVE together, realigning themselves into six groups of five, spreading out to atta different areas of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE'S GROUP
dialogues.text: The first attack group, Steve's, are the first to near th colossal alien craft. Simultaneously they drop their AIM- sidewinder missiles.

dialogues.speaker: PACK OF AIM-9 SIDEWINDER MISSILES
dialogues.text: They reach the same quarter-mile proximity and EXPLODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must have some kind of protective shield surrounding their hull.  Pull up. Most of the fighters do, but one is too late and SMASHES the ship's protective shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve's squadron BANKS hard, skirting the edge of the shi protective shield. As the fighters approach, the alien ship's enormous ATTAC doors OPEN.  Suddenly DOZENS OF ALIEN ATTACKERS dart out towards our fighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evasive maneuvers!  Check Six! Just moving away in time, our Fighters barely dodge the oncoming enemy Attackers as they FIRE a HAILSTORM of FIRE (tracker bullet-like lasers) showering the sky. As Steve's plane DIVES, an Attacker follows.  Jimmy's pla pulls up behind the attacker.

dialogues.speaker: HEADS UP DISPLAY
dialogues.text: Jimmy's HUD has the alien attacker in his sights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you covered, Stevie. Jimmy FIRES, another AIM-9 Sidewinder TAKES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN ATTACKER
dialogues.text: The Sidewinder overtakes the attacker as Steve ROLLS AWAY of position.  Five yards before the sidewinder can get to Attacker, it EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  They've got shield too.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE'S FIGHTER
dialogues.text: Banks back around to get a shot.  Just as he turns, three American Fighters are BLOWN TO RIBBONS from Attacker trac fire. The Attackers are in hot pursuit of Jimmy's fighter.  The Fighter flying next to Jimmy is DEMOLISHED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, roll right.  I'll cover. Jimmy's fighter narrowly rolls away from the tracer fire Steve fires another Sidewinder, momentarily distracting t Attacker. Jimmy falls in line with Steve as the attackers turn on t Both fighters jerk downwards at a ninety degree angle at ONE.  Narrowly missing the ground, they bank away.  The Attackers can't follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighter after fighter begin to disappear from the display screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get them out of there. Suddenly one of the large radar display maps FIZZLES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost the satellite. Before he can adjust, another monitor FIZZLES AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one we SEE the fighters getting TAKEN OUT.  Fireba litter the laser-tracer fire covered skies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can out run them.  Follow my lead. Jimmy and Steve bank away from the craft, hit the supercr BOLTING AWAY at Mach 2. Both  Jimmy and Steve are held tight against their seats, straining against the G-Force. Two Attackers spot them and follow in hot pursuit. Steve and Jimmy are flying at breakneck speeds, the attac slowly gaining on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, kick it!  They're gaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're already over Mach 2!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So push it! Readouts show the  planes flying beyond measurement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the  planes accelerate, Jimmy fights to remain conscio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie... I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, stay with me. Jimmy slowly loses consciousness.  His fighter slows, dri off to the right.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN ATTACKERS
dialogues.text: gain on them.  One catches up with Jimmy's fighter and FI

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY'S FIGHTER
dialogues.text: Laser-tracers SHOWER the Fighter.  It EXPLODES.  Job done Attacker banks away, returning to Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!!! Steve's Attacker stays right with him, slowly gaining.  S kicks his harder, keeping the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A radar OPERATOR spots something on his screens.  He turn Captain Watson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have incoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friendly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Watson hits an alarm which ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen PILOTS race out onto the field, running for their planes.  Before anyone can reach them, the sky darkens wi ALIEN ATTACKERS who STRAFE the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the front glass of the tower we SEE the Attackers firing.  One fires directly at the tower.  Watson DIVES f cover as everything around him erupts into a gigantic FIREBALL.

dialogues.speaker: EL TORO
dialogues.text: The entire base goes up in flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve looks down over the side of his fighter.

dialogues.speaker: THE GRAND CANYON
dialogues.text: Steve HITS THE BRAKES.  Surprised, the Attacker SAILS PAS Taking the moment, Steve DIVES down INTO THE GRAND CANYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, jerk-off.  Let's have some fun. The Attacker recovers, dives after Steve who flies danger close to the canyon walls.  The Attacker has trouble keep up with him but does. Steve puts on a clinic in advanced aerobatics, banking, diving, swerving. The Attacker seems to be improving, following closer and closer. Steve ducks into smaller canyons, twisting sideways.  Sti the Attacker follows close.

dialogues.speaker: FUEL GAUGE
dialogues.text: Near empty.  Frustrated, Steve gets pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! Steve turns down a dead and side canyon.  The Attacker is right on his tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see if you're fully equipped. The Fighter is on a collision course with the end of the canyon wall.  Suddenly Steve yanks his ACES II - EJECTION SEAT. Stave SAILS UPWARDS into the air. The Fighter CRASHES into the canyon wall. The Attacker can't turn in time.  He tries to pull up, ov it, just misses the top of the canyon wall. As the nose of the Attacker hits the tip of the canyon wa the Attacker is FLIPPED OVER, ROLLING END OVER END over t top of the canyon. The parachute on Steve's ejection seat pops OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling end over end, the Attacker is banged up BADLY as finally comes to a stop. Not far away, Steve has a quick, hard, landing.  Rolling Steve quickly pops the buckles on the chute and frees him He stands and looks around.  Spotting the beat up and incapacitated alien Attacker, Steve gets an angry resolve look.  He marches over to the fallen alien Attacker.  He it quickly, spots a type of door that has been knocked aj With all his might, Steve YANKS the door OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: AN ALIEN
dialogues.text: For the first time we get a quick glance at these aliens, odd hybrid creature with fluctuating skeletal structure. The reason we only get a quick glance is because the mome turns woozily towards us, Steve rears back and SLUGS HIM THE FACE, knocking the alien totally unconscious. His anger finally subsiding, exhaustion taking over, Stev stands over the craft, slowly withdrawing the prized Vict Dance cigar.  He lights it and takes a long angry puff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's a close encounter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark.  The hole Jasmine had entered is now blocked. pushes but it won't budge.  Exhausted, she ignites her li to get a better look around. As it lights we SEE that we are inside a maintenance gara Jasmine rushes over to a phone but the line is dead.  Tak Dylan by the hand she moves to the large garage doors but can't open them. She turns around and see a large maintenance truck, a hug land-mover shovel attached to the front.  She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a ROAR the large door BLAST APART as the maintenance truck SMASHES through.  Once out, Jasmine hits the brakes REVERSE ANGLE - JASMINE'S POV - DEVASTATED L.A. Total devastation.  Remnants of cars and buildings smolde Three scattered survivors crawl from the wreckage.  A nightmare of destruction.  The space craft above, slowly leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (astonished)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see dozens of trailers packing up their gear, some alr on the road.  Miguel talks with one of the drivers, then hurries away, running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell wipes down Troy's forehead, he's burning up.  Ali brings over a cold compress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're just like your mother.  She was stubborn too.  I had to twist her arm to get her to take her medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Dad. (beat; scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not goin to die like mom, am

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be fine. Miguel comes rushing in, pulls Russell aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't find anything. Everyone is packing up, they're leaving.  Word is a space ship is heading this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should leave too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a group heading south, they said there's a hospital just a couple hours away.  I think we should follow them. Russell nods in agreement.  A knock on the door.  Alicia to find a handsome young boy, PHILIP in the doorway holdi bottle of pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penicillin.  At least it will help keep his fever down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really nice of you to help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could do more but we're moving out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too eager)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going with you.  I mean, we're going too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Alicia nods, smitten.  Philip smiles charmingly and leave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the passenger section, the President sits with Ge Grey and Chief of Staff Nimziki.  The Technician from the command module is briefing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must be targeting our satellites.  We've lost all satellite communication, tracking and mapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have NORAD relay intelligence to our on board computers? The Technician nods and exits.  Defeated, the President s sullenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've moved as many of our forces away from the bases as possible but we've already sustained heavy losses. The President nods his approval absently.  Coming out of bathroom, David overhears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spoke with the Joint Chief when they arrived at NORAD.  They agree, we must launch a counter offensive with a full nuclear strike.  Hit 'em with everything we've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above American soil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't strike soon, there may not be much of an America left to defend. The Technician returns, his face is white with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the latest from NORAD?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone, sir.  They've taken out NORAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, the Vice President and the  Joint Chiefs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, we must launch.  A delay now would be more costly than when you waited to evacuate the cities! That stings the President.  He considers the option.  Dav shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be seriously considering firing nuclear weapons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, don't... David pushes past her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you fire nukes, so will the rest of the world.  Do you know what that kind of fall out will do?  How many innocent people... The General gets up running interference.  Constance trie pull David back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stern)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, i remind you that you are just a guest here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insanity!  You'll kill us and them at the same time. There'll be nothing left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down and shut up! Suddenly Moishe is on his feet, interrupting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell him to shut up!  You'd all be dead, were it not for my David.  You didn't do anything to prevent this! As everyone is about to besiege Moishe, the President tri calm him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, there wasn't much more we could have done.  We were totally unprepared for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me unprepared!  Since nineteen fifty whatever you guys have had that space ship, the thing you found in New Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it, Roswell?  You had the space ship, the bodies, everything locked up in a bunker, the what is it, Area fifty one.  That's it! Area fifty one.  You knew and you didn't do nothing! For the first time in along time, President Whitmore smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regardless of what the tabloids have said, there were never any space crafts recovered by the government.  Take my word for it, there is no Area 51 and no recovered space ship. Chief of Staff Nimziki suddenly clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, excuse me, Mr. President, but that's not entirely accurate. The President and General Grey turn to Nimziki, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: SMASHED AND BURNED OUT CARS
dialogues.text: laying across the roadway.  Suddenly SMASH, Jasmine's maintenance truck BLASTS through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the massive devastation in the b.g., Jasmine drives maintenance truck down the highway.  In the back, the few survivors she's found. In the back, four INJURED PASSENGERS lay across the flatb a thin, older man, TEDDY tends to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jasmine spots a TALL MAN, his closes in tatters RUNNING d the highway, his arms in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end has come!  He speaketh his word and the end hast come! Jasmine pulls up along side him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hop on.  We're heading out to El Toro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot defy what has come, it is the end! The tall man moves off, screaming to the heavens.  As Jas watches him drift away she SEES...

dialogues.speaker: OVERTURNED MILITARY HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Still smoldering from the crash.  A woman can be seen ins still alive.  Jasmine jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a hand. Teddy joins Jasmine as they pry open the door.  Inside, t pilots have been killed, but Mrs. Whitmore, THE FIRST LAD lays there in great pain, blood across her blouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get her out of here. They erase her from the wreckage, laying her on the ground.  Dylan comes over, standing next to his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's bleeding pretty bad. Suddenly we HEAR the CLICKING of a rifle COCKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got the key? Jasmine turns and see a REDNECK leveling his rifle at her Behind him a small damaged sports car pulls up, packed to gills with stolen, looted appliances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling to pals)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like I've solved our transportation problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're welcome to come with us.  We're leaving here anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not.  Give me the key. (yelling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get 'em off. Two GUYS rush from their vehicle over to the maintenance truck, pulling the injured off the tailback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repent!  Sinners!  Repent!  The end hast come! Running up from behind, the Tall Man comes over screaming The Redneck turns his gun on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off.  This ain't your business. As the Redneck is distracted, Jasmine spots the bag of fireworks protruding out of Dylan's back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot go against the word, brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I can. The Redneck SHOOTS the Tall Man.  His buddies laugh. REDNECK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now give me that key, bitch. As he turns back to Jasmine, Boomer starts BARKING wildly Just as he turns to shoot the dog, Jasmine lights a key R from the fireworks bag.  The rocket BLASTS into the Redne his shirt IGNITING ON FIRE. The Redneck drops the rifle, attempting to put out the fl his cronies rush to his aid.  Jasmine picks up the gun, m in on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This "bitch" was born in  Alabama with a Daddy who loved to hunt. (cocking the weapon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't think for one second that I don't know how to use this. She FIRES the rifle.  Quickly the rednecks scamper away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dragging a heavy bundle wrapped in his parachute, Steve marches across the desert floor.  The alien ARM/TENTACLE dangles out of the parachute. Exhausted, Steve stops to wipe his brow.  He hears someth turns around.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAILER ARMADA
dialogues.text: Several hundred of the trailers from the refugee camp are headed en mass towards him.  Smiling, Steve signals them. The trailers pull up on either side, surrounding him.  Mi leans out of his trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a lift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I flew overhead, I saw some kind of base, not far. Confused, Miguel checks his map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not on the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, it's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying over the desert, Air Force One sails over an immen valley, Area 51 below - hangars, a few buildings, a small strip, not much. Super: N.I.A. Base - "Area 51", Nevada

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One lands.  Wheels touch down, skid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large hangar doors open and Air Force One is rolled inside.  The President and his entourage are met by a contingent of base personnel led by field operative, LT. MITCHELL.  He escorts them to a side hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Mitchell walks over to an odd wall switch as the Pres and his entourage wait in the center of the hall.  With a hydraulic HUM, the entire hallway begins to SINK DOWN, an enormous ELEVATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell wasn't I told about this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two words, Mr. President. Plausible deniability. General Grey shoots Nimziki a pissed off look.  When the elevator stops, a door SLIDES open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping out of the elevator, they walk into a large stat the art, sterile clean research facility.  It is amazingl well staffed and organized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.  Where did all this come from?  How did this get funded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't think they actually spent ten thousand dollars for a hammer and thirty thousand for a toilet seat, did you? The President shoots him a look.  They are greeted by a g of SCIENTISTS in whit coats led by, DR. OKUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, I'd like to introduce you to Dr. Okun.  He's been heading up our research here for the last fifteen years. Dr. Okun is an odd, hyper-energetic man who's spent too m time in isolation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, a real pleasure. They don't let us out much, you you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess you'd like to see the big tamale?  Follow me. They walk up a ramp at the end of the room.  Large heavil enforced doors SLIDE open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group steps inside and nearly gasps at...

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN ATTACKER
dialogues.text: Just like the one that chased Steve.  The entourage stare horror and wonder.  We can SEE the patch-work repairs the made on the ship over the years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a beaut, ain't she? Moishe leans close to David and Constance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never any space ships recovered by the government, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had this for forty years and you don't know anything about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no, we know tons about them. The nearest stuff has only happened in the last few days. The President slowly walks around the ship as Okun talks. David, mouth agape, just stares at it. OKUN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, we can't duplicate their type of power so we've never been able to experiment.  But since these guys started showing up, all the gizmos inside turned on.  The last twenty four hours have been really exciting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are dying out there.  I don't think "exciting" is the word I'd choose to describe it! The room goes silent, letting the President blow off stea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you tell us about the enemy we're facing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all too dissimilar to us. Breathes oxygen, comparable tolerances to heat, cold...probably why they're interested in our planet. (suddenly excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna see them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights slowly TURN ON, illuminated the vault.  Okun l the group to a sealed partition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is vault, or as some of us have come to call it, the "freak show." Okun hits a switch and the sealed partition lifts reveali

dialogues.speaker: FORMALDEHYDE TANKS
dialogues.text: Three dead aliens float in the milky formaldehyde tanks. murky fluid and condensation obstructs our view.  What we see is not pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we found them they were wearing bio-mechanical suits. Once we got them off, we were able to learn a great deal about their anatomy; eyes, ears, bipolar digestive system... no vocal cords though.  We're assuming they communicate with each other through other means. David cannot contain his fascination.  He steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of other means?  Hand signals, body language?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kind of extra sensory perception.  Telepathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can they be killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These three died in the crash. Their bodies are as frail as our own.  You just have to get past their technology, which is, I'm sorry to say, far more advanced. The President turns to David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You unlocked a part of that technology.  You cracked their code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I did was stumble onto their signal.  I don't know how helpful I can be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show them what you've discovered. Work together.  We've got to find a way to beat them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four armed GUARDS watch the gate.  An armada of trucks an trailers heads right for them.  They move into position t block their entrance as a blue pick-up skids to a halt be them.  Steve stands up from the back of the pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Lt. Colonel, I can't open the gates without clearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see my clearance? Impatiently Steve grabs the Guard by the collar, pulling over the side of the truck putting him face to face with bundled parachute in the flatbed.  Steve rips the fabric revealing...

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN CREATURE
dialogues.text: Still unconscious, the alien stirs.  The Guard JUMPS BACK shitting in his pants.  Quickly he signals for the other open the gate. The armada quickly drives past.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: Total darkness.  Suddenly light pours in as a  door is op We see the faces of Okun, David and three technicians all peering at us with inquisitive expressions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the gizmos flashing?

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Sure enough, tons of gizmos with lights flashing.  High t meets organic organisms.  This alien ship looks familiar our own technology and completely different at the same t OKUN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been working around the clock trying to get a fix on all this crap.  Some stuff we figured out right away. David climbs in, fascinated.  He touches everything.  Oku points to everything as he describes it. OKUN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing we're pretty sure is the life support for the cabin, this do-hickey over here is connected with the engines, this crap...we have no idea what that stuff is for. David is transfixed by it.  He stares at the small screen with flashing light patterns on them. OKUN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this over here is clearly what they use to navigate and guide the craft. But David still stares at the small screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone grab my laptop for me? One of the technicians rushes off as Okun leans close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find something interesting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. The technician hands David his retrieved laptop which he quickly flips open and turns on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These patterns here, they're repeating sequentially, just like... David turns his laptop around for Okun to see.  The patte David's laptop flashes identically as the alien screen. DAVID (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...their countdown signal.  Their using this frequency for computer communications.  It's how they co- ordinate their ships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're really starting to make us look bad. The two men exchange a smile.  Another TECHY pops his hea inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got one!  They got one, alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bundled alien lays on a stretcher that's wheeled quic into the hall.  Okun and his staff surround it.  Trailing behind them is Steve, Russell and Miguel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has it been unconscious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me Doctor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him into containment, stat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boy is very sick, he needs immediate attention. Okun ignores Russell, hitting the elevator switch on the the room begins its hydraulic HUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dying out.  I want him sprayed down with saline. Russell SLAMS his fist against the switch, the room stops GRABS a doctor nearby, gets in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boys is slipping into a diabetic coma.  If you don't do something about it right now he will die. Miguel is surprised and proud of Russell as he holds DOCT ISAACS, meaning business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Haver, Miller, come with me. (to Russell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take us to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights pierce the darkness as the maintenance truck r to a stop.  Jasmine climbs down out of the truck, her fac ashen. She walks past a sign reading: El Toro Marine Corps Air Station.  Tears begin to roll from her eyes.  We follow h gaze to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire facility is smoldering, the last remnants of t fire burning itself to extinction.  Jasmine is devastated

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Grey and Nimziki are in a heated argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the head of the National Intelligence Agency!  You knew all about this.  When were you planning on informing the rest of us!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It had been deemed classified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, why didn't you say anything about this when they first arrived?  You could have warned us before we launched a counter attack that cost us hundreds of American pilots! Just then the President enters along with Constance and s other ADVISORS.  He examines a paper map of the United St tacked to the wall, each major city circled in black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atlanta, Chicago and Philadelphia, destroyed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (composing himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there are scattered reports of sightings over Miami, Ft. Worth, And Memphis. The President and his team take seats at the large confer table. GENERAL GREY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've learned that NATO and western allied installations were the firs to be taken out.  We were next.  They knew exactly where and how to hit us. Grey sneaks an accusatory glare at Nimziki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our forces?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're down to approximately fifteen percent, Sir. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you calculate the time it takes them to destroy a city and move on, we're looking at world wide destruction of every major city within the next thirty six hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're being exterminated. The room is quiet.  Constance runs her fingers through he hair.  The door to the room opens and Lt. Mitchell enters Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, this is Lt. Colonel Steven Hill. The President quickly gets to his feet, anxiously shaking Steve's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the prisoner now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have him in isolation.  The doctors are very hopeful he will survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. The General is concerned but the President is determined. They head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to General Grey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General, I'm anxious to get back to El Toro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't anyone tell you?  I'm sorry.  El Toro was destroyed in the attack. Steve is shattered, he had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The injured are gathered around a small camp fire.  Jasmi walks up, dumping a box full of charred can goods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These should last us a while. As Margaret tries to move, she winces in pain.  Jasmine r to her aid.  The color from her face drained, Margaret lo like she's taking a turn for the worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move.  Stay still. Jasmine adjusts the bandages as Margaret turns and see Dy curled up next to Boomer, too adorable.  Slowly he starts wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was his father stationed here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't his father.  I was kinda hoping he'd want the job, though. Jasmine becomes sad, remembering.  Margaret changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do yo do for a living?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a dancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Ballet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Exotic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be.  I'm not.  It's good money. (re: Dylan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Side, he's worth it. The bandages changed, Jasmine sits down next to Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when the dancing's over?  What about your future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, it used to scare me when I thought about the future. (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it doesn't really matter anymore. Dylan comes walking over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, come here.  I want you to meet the First Lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't recognize me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't want to say anything.  I voted for the other guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okun and two Medical assistants examine the alien creatur His arms and chest have been strapped down to the examini table. For the first time we get a good look at the head of this creature, long tentacled-type cords interlocked, covering face.  The doctors attach clamps to each of the cords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone ready? The doctors exchange nervous glances, nod to each other. the same moment all they pull on the clamps, unraveling t interlocked cords.  As the cords unravel, we SEE that thi in fact a bio-mechanical SUIT as we REVEAL...

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Beneath the cords lay the unconscious face of the alien, skin translucent, his body fluids, capillaries, muscle ti alien's skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have life support monitors recording?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  If we fuck up it'll all be on tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get some ventilation in here?  I can't take this smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've conquered space travel but not b.o. As Okun begins to put on a pair of surgical gloves he sud grabs his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  It's just that stink gives me a headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's moving! Instantly everyone's attention is riveted to the arm of t alien as it moves beneath the sheet.  Unseen by the other alien creature's EYES OPEN. Another SHARP PAIN hits Okun who SCREAMS, stumbling backw grabbing his head.  The others turn in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Suddenly SPRINGS up, the restraining straps SNAPPING.  Be Med #2 can react, one of the alien's tentacles SMASHES he across the face.  She is sent sprawling backwards.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Standing before her.  In a wink of an eye, he ATTACKS, le on her. Together they TUMBLE back into a formaldehyde tank.  Hose are ripped from their sides and STEAM pours out.  We get glimpse of their struggle as the steam engulfs them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell leads the Presidential party down the hall.  The turn and enter the Medical lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group slows as they enter the room.  They see the containment room through the glass is covered with white steam.  Nothing can be seen.  It's eerily quiet. Cautiously they approach.  Suddenly Okun is SLAMMED AGAIN the glass partition, the creature's tentacles wrapped aro him.  Pressed firmly to the glass, his eyes are shut, his expression pained, but when he speaks the voice is angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release...me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door.  Get him out of there. Suspicious, General Grey stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. (to Okun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will kill...release me.  Now! They follow the tentacles with their eyes, up to the ceil of the containment tank.  Suddenly the alien LEAPS DOWN, startling them, landing before them behind the glass. We see he's holding Okun against the glass, speaking THRO HIM.  This is the first real good look we get at the this creature.  Everyone in the room is repulsed and compelled it at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the hundreds of campers and trailers parked outsi Steve runs past until he reaches the open tarmac. A transport helicopter sits on the edge of the landing ar Steve runs up to it and climbs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve quickly starts it engines, preparing to take off. SOLDIER rushes over to the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?  Get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just going to borrow it. The Soldier pulls out his pistol, taking aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to shoot me? Steve stares the Soldier down.  Reluctantly he lowers his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  I'm gonna catch the hell for this. Steve smiles and gives him a quick salute then TAKES OFF. Quickly the bird RISES UP and darts off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President has moved closer to the glass and is talkin with the alien.  The alien uses Okun like a ventriloquist dummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you people come here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air...water...your "sun."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do your people come from? (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is your home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here...now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And before here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many worlds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we negotiate a truce?  is there room for co-existance? (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can there be peace between us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peace?  No peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want us to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Die. The Alien moves closer to the glass staring at the Presid Suddenly the President clutches his head in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We kill you...all. The pain becomes more severe and the President SCREAM OUT There is general panic as people rush to the President's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mitchell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that glass bullet proof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir. The General draws his pistol.  Mitchell and the other mil officers follow his lead.  Simultaneously they all begin

dialogues.speaker: FIRE
dialogues.text: The glass SHATTERS into a billion pieces.  The Alien is c ribbons, falling backwards. The President collapses.  So does Okun.  A STAFFER rushes to Okun, checks his pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. General Grey moves to the President who slowly recovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, are you okay? Woozily the President sits up, a strange look in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted me to understand.  He communicated with me. (turning to Grey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're like locusts.  They travel from planet to planet, their whole civilization.  After they've consumed every natural resource they move on.  And we're next. The President stands with a new resolve.  He stares at th dead alien on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare a nuclear strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The research staff are working near the recovered alien attacker.  Constance comes rushing in.  She looks around David.  Through the glass of one of the offices she sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding a bottle of Jack Daniels, David fishes through a refrigerator as Constance enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just my luck, no ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it you've heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toast to the end of the world. David toasts her with the bottle, takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't come to this decision lightly. David nods, he doesn't want to argue.  He smiles cynicall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still believe in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better be.  You left me for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted a career.  Didn't you ever want to be part of something special? David stares daggers at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was part of something special. Constance realizes he means their marriage.  She's hurt h and can see it.  She turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black shadow is vaguely seen in the dark night.  As we some moonlit clouds we recognize the shadow is, in fact, STEALTH BOMBER. As we WIDEN, we see that the bomber is part of a squadron eight.  These mighty winged giants fly together in attack formation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tracking screen comes to life, eight blips flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got the AWAC on line. Signals coming in low. The President's group takes their position behind the technicians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eight B-2 Stealth Bombers break formation, each headi off to their different target destinations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a large map, we see the eight target destinations and planes heading for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who will we reach first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houston, Texas.  Intercept ETA, six minutes and counting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The major cities have been deserted.  Civilian casualties should be at a minimum, sir. One map screen, ENLARGES, tracking the bomber on route to Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looters take all they can carry through the broken glass front.  A large heavily armored TANK rolls up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous military technicians work equipment as their TANK COMMANDER pulls down a periscope.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE SHIP OVER HOUSTON
dialogues.text: Through the periscopes cross-hairs we SEE downtown Housto the City Destroyer space ships settling in above it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silhouetted against the shimmering waters on the bay, the Stealth Bomber can be seen as it approaches Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flight crew works their computers (similar readouts a seen at command center).  The Multi-Function Display (MFD flashing before each crew member.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have laser targeting locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Target is locked, sir.  Do you wish to deploy? Everyone turns to the President who does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, do you wish to deploy. Still there is no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deploy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bay doors open and a large Tactical Nuclear Cruise Mi drops down, flies parallel with the bomber as it adjusts radar and laser tracking.  Suddenly it SHOOTS OFF. The bomber BANKS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the horizon twisting away as we bank off from targ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the big map we see one FLASHING target line tracking t missile as it approaches Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May our children forgive us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tank Commander readjusts the periscope.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE SHIP
dialogues.text: We follow the Cruise Missile as it guides itself on a dir collision course with the space craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The targeting map shows how close the missile is, nearly top of the target.  Everyone in the room holds their brea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nuke speeds closer.  It HITS the protective shield an DETONATES.  A FLASH OF LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSTON
dialogues.text: With the B-2 Stealth Bomber in the foreground, the city b it vanishes in a FLASH OF LIGHT, blinding us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see the extent of the explosion on the targeting m tracking it -- an expanding ring around Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hit! The others are still waiting.  The monitor shows the nigh vision picture of the growing MUSHROOM CLOUD rising above city.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: The MUSHROOM CLOUD engulfs the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocked by the massive explosion, the shock wave ROCKS the armored tank but doesn't destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men inside are KNOCKED around, hard from the explosio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the bastards! General Grey shoots Nimziki a look.  The President holds hand, silencing the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can they see it?  Did it destroy the target?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cloud begins to dissipate we see THE SPACE CRAFT I STILL THERE, completely unharmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative.  Target remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitors as well, we can see the target remain.  T air is let out of the room, everyone deflated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other bombers might have more luck.  We shouldn't just give up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said call them back. As the technicians call the bombers away, the President s into a depression.  His last hope of survival gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jasmine keeps Margaret company as the rest sleep around t last flames of their campfire.  From the worried expressi Jasmine's face we can tell that Margaret has gotten worse wounds bleeding badly. A WIND kicks up, the sound of an ENGINE approaching.  Jas squints her eyes looking up into the wind when a BRIGHT L engulfs her.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTS
dialogues.text: Bright lights in the sky growing nearer.  Slowly the othe begin to wake up, frightened as the lights INTENSIFY. The others slowly begin to retreat but Jasmine stands, st defiantly.  A smile creeps across her face as she sees th the lights belong to...

dialogues.speaker: TRANSPORT HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: The Transport Helicopter touches down and Steve leaps out racing towards Jasmine.  Overwhelmed, Jasmine jumps into arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how I like to make a big entrance. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The double doors burst open as the President carrying his young daughter marches through.  Doctor ISAACS comes over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. President.  If only we could have gotten to her sooner. The President puts his daughter down as he sees...

dialogues.speaker: MARGARET
dialogues.text: Margaret lays in bed, doctors and nurses surrounding her. Patricia rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's bleeding internally. There's nothing else we can do. Stunned, the President watches as Patricia hugs her mothe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya Munchkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, we were worried.  We didn't know where you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here, baby. Recovering, the President nods for the doctors to leave t room.  As they begin to march out, he makes his way over his wife and daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, why don't you wait outside so Mommy can get some rest. Patricia kisses her mother, says goodbye and leaves.  Out sight, Margaret winces, fading away.  The President grabs hand for support.  She squeezes tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  The doctors said you're going to be just fine. Margaret smiles at the man she knows all too well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar. The look between them says more than any words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President exits the room, overcome with emotion. Constance, the doctors and some medical crew move to comf him.  He holds them off with a gesture. He looks up and sees Jasmine, Steve and Dylan down the ha He pushes through the crowd and makes his way over to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to thank you. You're a very brave woman. Across the hall, Patricia sits in a chair, waiting.  Whit walks over to her and kneels down next to his small child

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Mommy sleeping now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, baby.  Mommy's sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: A GARBAGE CAN
dialogues.text: Topples over with a BANG!  A foot steps in and starts kic trash all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David is drunkenly knocking everything over, making a gig mess.  Moishe comes up behind, restraining him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, David!  What the hell are you doing!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This I can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta burn the rain forest, Pops.  Dump toxic waste, pollute the air, rip up the ozone.  Maybe if we screw this planet up enough they won't want it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, you're drunk. David slips, falls on his ass, hard.  Moishe helps him ba on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you better sleep this off. Go back inside before you catch a cold. Slowly David looks up towards Moishe, an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops, you're a genius!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold?  Of course. Sobered, David jumps kisses his father and bolts inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large crowd has been gathered here at the lab.  General and Nimziki walk up to Constance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Connie, we're here. What's this all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really have no idea.  He just said to bring everyone down here. Steve shows Dylan the alien space craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that thing fly in outer space? Steve loos up at the craft admiringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It certainly does. When the President enters a technician rushes over and kn on the hatch door on the alien attacker.  The door swings and David climbs down. Grabbing a coke can from the "recycle" trash bin, David p the empty can on top of the alien attacker.  David turns faces the gathering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could anyone please step back away from the craft? They do and David nods to a Technician inside the craft. Technician disappears inside, closing the door behind him loud HUM emits from the craft.  David has to yell over it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Mitchell, would you mind drawing your pistol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From where you're standing, do you think you could shoot that can off the alien craft? Mitchell shrugs affirmatively.  David gestures for him to Taking aim, Mitchell SHOOTS. The bullet RICOCHETS off the attacker's protective shield Several people in the crowd dock, afraid of being hit by errant bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry 'bout that.  You see, it's protected by the craft's shields. We can't penetrate their defenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know that already.  What's your point? David walks over to his laptop, now connected directly to craft by cables and starts typing furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My point is if we can't beat their defenses, then we must get around them. David stops typing and stares at his wrist watch, silentl counting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Mitchell, would you please try to shoot it again? Reluctantly Mitchell obliges.  This time the can is BLOWN THE CRAFT.  Everyone in the room is shocked.  The Technic re-opens the craft's door and the loud HUM disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave it a cold. The President is fascinated, he steps closer.  Moishe bea proudly at his smart son.  Constance is amazed. DAVID (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More accurately, I gave it a virus.  A computer virus. David turns his laptop around for the President to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling us you can send out a signal that will disable all their shields?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as they used our satellites against us, we can use their own signal against them. David walks over to a diagram he's made showing the relationship between the Mother Ship, the Space Crafts an smaller alien attackers. DAVID (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we plant the virus directly into the mother ship, it would then filter down into all the corresponding ships below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just how do we infect the "Mother Ship" with a virus? David gestures to the alien attacker behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to fly their craft out of our atmosphere and dock with the mother ship. Intrigued Steve turns and looks back at the alien attacke sizing it up.  David points to a satellite photo of the underbelly of the Mother Ship. DAVID (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can enter here, upload the virus and set off an explosion that could disable it.  This would disorient the smaller ship below and buy you some time to take them out. Constance reacts, realizing David's participation in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long would their shields be down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once they discover the virus it could be a matter of minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to co-ordinate a massive world wide counter strike with a window of only a few minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With their shields down it might be possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, you're not buying into any of this nonsense, are you?  We don't have the manpower or the resources to launch that kind of a campaign. (gesturing to the alien ship)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention that this whole cockamamie plan is dependent on a machine that no one in the world is qualified to operate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say that, sir. Everyone turns to Steve who steps through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen them in action.  I've watched their maneuvers.  With your permission, sir, I'd like the opportunity to try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing's a wreck.  It crash landed back in the fifties!  We don't even know if it's capable of flying. David turns to the Technicians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remove the clamps! Technicians move to the large holding clamps on either si the craft.  With a loud CLANK, the clamps are pulled away For a moment the hulking craft TEETERS unevenly, but quic stabilizes, FLOATING ABOVE THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any other questions? Everyone stares at the floating ship with wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constance, General Grey and the President are walking dow hall.  Nimziki rushes to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that you're upset over the death of your wife but that's no excuse for making another fatal mistake... The President whirls, grabs Nimziki and SLAMS him against wall.  Holding him tight, the President gets in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only mistake I made was appointing a sniveling little weasel like you Chief of Staff. Constance is about to intervene when General Grey stops h PRESIDENT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is a mistake, I am thankful to say, I do not have to live with.  Mr. Nimziki, you're fired. The President releases him and turns to General Grey. PRESIDENT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Organize every plane you can find and get some Goddamned pilots to fly them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir. He storms off leaving everyone stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four BRITISH AIR PILOTS are gathered around a table going a map.  One pilot, REGINALD, is in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we've been told that there may be additional re-enforcement in hiding near the Golan Straights... Suddenly the flap to the tent opens.  All the pilots draw their pistols frightening the ARAB PILOT who stands in th doorway.  The Arab Pilot speaks quickly in Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's he saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems they're getting a signal. One Morse code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
