dialogues.text: As they step out of the tent we SEE more than a HUNDRED FIGHTERS PLANES from different nations parked around them They've all gone into hiding out here in the desert, divi into many smaller camps. Reginald and Thomson follow their Arab cohort, walking th the many other campsites.  Thomson gets some stares from IRAQI PILOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still get believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Iraqis don't appear altogether too pleased with this arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think the Israelis feel? Sure enough a campsite of ISRAELI PILOTS sits very near b

dialogues.speaker: ARABIAN AIR FORCE CAMP
dialogues.text: Dozens of Arab pilots are gathered around a large radio a Morse code comes through.  Thomson quickly kneels down, t notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from the Americans.  They want to organize a counter offensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about bloody time.  What do they plan to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several Russian Pilots are gathered around a radio, their dozen MIG FIGHTERS standing behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They claims to be able to bring down their shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do they want to attack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the base of a large Volcano in Fuji, several Japanese attack helicopters stand near their pilots, gathered arou radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attack begins in thirteen hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large world map has been constructed.  Several sites ar marked with stickers reading: COMBAT READY.  Another stic is put onto Mr. Fuji. Striding in, the President surveys the war room.  General rushes over to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than we thought. General Grey leads the President over to the wall map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have confirmed divisions of troops from different armies all around the world.  Most of Europe, the Middle East and Asia are battle ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our troops here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been collecting planes from all over but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what, General?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilots, sir.  We don't have enough people to get them in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy is sleeping peacefully in his bed.  Russell sits at kitchen table as Miguel enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How' he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fell asleep.  He's gonna be just fine.  Join me in a little celebration? Russell holds up his bottle of Jack Daniels.  Clearly he' been drinking again.  Miguel is crestfallen.  Pissed he t and storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel.  Don't be mad.  Miguel! Drunkenly, Russell chases after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making his way through the campers, Russell SEES a group refugees around some MILITARY OFFICERS who addresses them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through megaphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We're planning to launch a counter offensive... Russell wanders over towards them. OFFICER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with our depleted manpower we must ask that anyone with any flight experience come forward. Military training is preferable but anyone who can fly a plane could be useful... Russell pushes his way through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurred)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can fly, I mean, I'm a pilot. The officer just stares at the bottle of Jack Daniels sti his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. Russell gets into his face, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.  I've gotta be part of this.  This is important to me.  They ruined my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go somewhere and sleep it off. The Officers move on, taking a few volunteers with them. Russell watches them go, dejected.  Angrily, he throws th bottle of Jack, SMASHING it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large MISSILE slides back into a LAUNCHER that has been attached to the top of the alien attacker.  Some workers over the patch-work repairs.  Below, Mitchell briefs Stev David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've hid the launcher in the ship's manifold. Mitchell takes a small black box from a table near by. MITCHELL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will be attached to the ships main console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just like an AMRAAM launch pad on the stealths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  Use it the same way. Only the nuke won't detonate on impact.  You'll have another thirty seconds to get as far away as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see how they're doing with the radio transmitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, we're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll meet you there. Steve dashes off as David moves toward the attacker. Constance has been eavesdropping.  She walks to David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds?  Isn't that cutting it a little too close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be well on our way out of there before we shoot that thing off. David leans under the attacker where a TECHNICIAN is atta another device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the strongest SHF transmitter we could get.  It'll tell us when you've uploaded the virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then cross your fingers the shields go down. David turns and walks away, Constance following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you?  I don't understand why you can't just show someone how to plant the virus, somebody trained for this kind of mission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything goes wrong I'll have to think quickly, adjust the signal, who knows? David stops, picking up a small trash can labelled "recyc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how I'm always trying to save the planet.  This is my chance. David rushes off.  Constance watches him leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he gets ambitious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jasmine is kneeling as Dylan tries to zip up the back of dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to borrow it.  I guess that's good enough. Jasmine stands, turns to Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I look? She looks great.  But Dylan only gives her the "so-so" ha gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a lot of help. The door behind her flies open and Steve marches in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, you like to make a big entrance. Steve moves next to Jasmine, takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we do this, I want you to know I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have done this a long long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the ring? As we REVERSE ANGLE we see that we are in a military CHAP large crucifix on the wall.  A CHAPLAIN stands by the alt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. Steve pulls out the famous "dolphin" ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witnesses? Just then the doors open and David and Constance enter ta seats on opposing sides of the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's get this show on the road. Steve and Jasmine take their places at the altar.  Jasmin radiant.  Dylan rushes up and joins them. As the ceremony begins, David and Constance share a pregn glance.  Slowly they reach across the aisle and hold hand Steve and Jasmine exchange their vows.

dialogues.speaker: HANGAR DOORS
dialogues.text: Slowly spread apart revealing the myriad of different pla that have been gathered.  Pilots, flights crews and refug prepare for the battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking out the President scans the motley collection of planes; old, new, high-tech, low-tech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beggars can't be choosers, sir. Nodding in agreement, the President walks among the rank file.  Slowly they turn their attention to the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.  In less than one hour planes from here and all around the world will launch the largest aerial battle in the history of mankind... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mankind.  The word has new meaning for all of us now.  We are reminded not of our petty differences but of our common interests. Constance, David and Moishe join the group, listening.  E David is moved. PRESIDENT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it's fate that today, July the Fourth, we will once again fight for our freedom.  Not from tyranny, persecution or oppression.  But from annihilation.  We're fighting for our right to live, to exit.  From this day on, the fourth day of July will no longer be remembered as an American holiday but as the day that all of mankind declared we will not go quietly into the night.  We will not vanish without a fight.  We will live on.  We will survive. The crowd erupts into applause and cheers.  The President turns and walks over to an Officer holding a bundle of clothes.  General Grey confronts the President as he begi disrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, just what do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a pilot, Will.  This is where I belong. General Grey wants to argue but can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constance and David embrace as Steve turns to Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I'm back we'll light those fireworks. Jasmine hugs them both as Moishe walks over to David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, take these. David looks down at the "barf bags" in Moishe's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Pops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you should know, I'm very proud of you, son. That means more to David than Moishe could have known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. Constance hugs David as Steve suddenly freaks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it.  We can't go yet.  I gotta find some cigars. Steve is about to bolt when Moishe grabs him, retrieving cigars from his coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My last two.  With my blessings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a lifesaver. Steve grabs them and climbs inside.  David smiles awkward then follows Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hatch shuts and David takes a seat next to Steve who him one of the cigars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on to this.  For our victory dance.  But not 'til we hear the fat lady sing. Reluctantly David takes it.  As he does Steve notices the "barf bag" on David's lap.  Off Steve's look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a confession to make.  I'm not real big on flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constance and Jasmine join the others behind the observat glass outside the room as the Attacker prepares for lift Part of the ceiling suddenly PEELS AWAY, revealing an eno SHAFT leading topside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strapping in and securing their equipment, Steve grabs ho the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?  Let' rock and roll. Steve pulls back on the throttle but the attacker swings BACKWARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien Attacker SMASHES BACKWARD into the rear of the Moishe winces as the others react fearfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embarrassed, Steve adjusts the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops. Like a stick shift diagram of a car, a small hand written "post it" card is pasted onto the dash.  Steve reaches ov and turns it upside down, righting the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try that again. This time he pushes the throttle forward and the Attacker JERKS ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting up into the ceiling shaft above, the Attacker ZO out of the underground laboratory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a WHOOSH the Alien Attacker ZOOMS out of the undergr shaft and SOARS into the sky.  Once high enough it goes i wild barrel roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as it comes out of the roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just getting a feel for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attacker arcs upward and disappears into the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President watches the Attacker flying away.  His cano locks down as he adjusts his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey, you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Eagle One, our primary target has shifted course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Grey is standing by the large map tracking the al ships over the United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's it headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think our secret is out. They're headed right for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ETA thirty six minutes. The President gets a determined look in his eye.  He FIRE his engine.  Following his lead, engines ignite, canopies down and planes taxi to position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The captured alien attacker soars higher and higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly getting sick, David holds onto his "barf bag."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still with me? David nods sheepishly.  Steve's eyes go wide with wonder the ship climbs to the edge of our atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've waited a long time for this. The ship begins to SHAKE, rattling harshly as it climbs. Through the window we SEE the blue sky EVAPORATE.  Slowly field of STARS take its place. This is the moment Steve had wished for all his life.  He not disappointed.  David, however, is not so thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading further into space, ZOOMING overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windshield we see a huge OBJECT floating in the distance, the moon behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  Head straight for it. But Steve gets distracted, something wrong with the contr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's happening.  It's not responding. David looks over at his laptop, connected to the ship's o board computers.  Th signal is ADJUSTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrilled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was counting on that.  They're bringing us in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President's plane leads thirty fighters in attack formation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have visual.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN SPACE CRAFT
dialogues.text: The fifteen mile wide space craft peeks over a mountain r headed straight for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not engage until we've confirmed the package has been delivered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constance is standing by Lt. Mitchell behind the Military cadre coordinating the battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if that thing gets here before we can plant the virus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire compound is buried deep within the mountain.  It should give us some protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about all the people outside? Mitchell shoots her a worried look.  Quickly they both da outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and David's attacker flies towards the gigantic Mot Ship.  Hundreds of other attackers flow in and out of the Mother Ship through the many triangular portals.  Steve a David's attacker's drawn into one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught in a stream of attackers, they flow through the po shaft leading into this planet sized space craft.  They p by enormous windows revealing the HUNDREDS OF ALIENS work within the Mother Ship. We spill out of the shaft and into a gigantic cavity stretching out beyond visibility.  Enormous TOWERS are scattered throughout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither can believe their eyes.  Staring out the front wi they SEES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below them THOUSANDS OF ALIENS can be seen as they are ma into dozens of enormous TROOP CONTAINERS docked at the ed of the parade grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be thousands of them.  What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like they're preparing the invasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass the parade ground and head into the middle of t huge cavernous sphere, closing in on the many LANDINGS. Hundreds of attackers are docked at each one. In the center of the Landing are large BAY WINDOWS, insid a kind of control tower.  We can SEE several ALIEN WORKER through the glass.  Steve and David's attacker is heading straight towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This won't work.  They'll see before we can do anything. Lifting up another hand written card labeled "window," Da pushes the button underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things are fully equipped. Reclining bucket seats, power windows... A BLAST SHIELD lowers covering the window. Slowly Steve and David's attacker lowers onto large docki CLAMPS which LOCK ON, holding it in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in! David starts typing frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell turns from one of the consoles to General Grey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's uploading the virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eagle One...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Presidential attack squadron zeroing in on target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the package is being delivered. Stand by to engage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alicia struggles to drag out a large duffle bag.  Philip boy who brought the penicillin earlier) rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get that. He grabs the bag for her.  Alicia smiles.  Miguel helps T down from the trailer.  As they rush away, Miguel turns t Philip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Russell?

dialogues.speaker: HANGAR
dialogues.text: Constance, Jasmine and Mitchell are helping to usher the refugees into the compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, we've got to get everyone inside. Constance looks up and SEES off in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN SPACE CRAFT
dialogues.text: Piercing the horizon, coming over the top of a distant mountain.  Headed this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David finishes typing.  The screen on his laptop flashes: UPLOAD COMPLETE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The virus is in.  All we can do now is pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delivery complete.  Engage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger. The fighter jets GUN IT and overtake the smaller planes i front of them. Below the President's plane the weapons bay door opens an long range AMRAAM Missile DROPS DOWN, computes its target DARTS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell and General Grey move over to a monitor showing visual from the Present's Plane.  They SEE the missile moving towards target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your fingers crossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilots watch nervously as the missile nears its targe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby.

dialogues.speaker: AMRAAM MISSILE
dialogues.text: Just as it gets to the shield perimeter, the missile EXPL The shields are still up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch the missile blow up harmlessly.  Deflated, Gen Grey grabs his mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't work.  Disengage.  Sir, get your people out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President is not ready to give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet! Below his plane another MISSILE drops down, and DARTS OFF

dialogues.speaker: MISSILE
dialogues.text: This one goes past the point of the previous explosion. moves in closer and closer.  Suddenly it HITS THE SIDE OF SHIP.  A HUGE EXPLOSION, rips off a part of the side of t immense ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE the explosion on the monitor.  Everyone in the roo CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it!  A direct hit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilots are thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going in!  Squadron leaders, take point. The fighters break off into six group of five.  One by on each fighter DROPS A MISSILE.  We follow DOZENS OF MISSIL their way to the space craft.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE CRAFT
dialogues.text: The Attacker Bay doors open and DOZENS OF ALIEN ATTACKERS shoot out.  Spreading wide. Guided missiles EXPLODES as they hit the City Destroyer, damaging the outer hull.  The Attackers go after the Amer fighters.  The six groups split wide.  An aerial dog figh ensues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel searches for Russell as the refugees run for the hangar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell! Miguel gets swept up in the tide.  As the last of them en the hangar, TWO ALIEN ATTACKERS arrive behind them, STRAF the ground.  The rows of trailers homes EXPLODE one after another.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Constance ushers the crowd into the elevator hallway.  Pa into the hallway together, they are panicked at the sound the nearby explosions.  As the last one is safely inside, Constance turns back and SEES...

dialogues.speaker: HANGAR AND ATTACKERS
dialogues.text: The attackers FIRE and the front half of the hangar EXPLO Constance is KNOCKED back against the wall.  She activate elevator and the room begins to SINK. As the hallway submerges, the entire hangar comes CRASHIN DOWN behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over monitors the General observes the aerial battle.  Th room, too, ROCKS from the explosions.  The monitors FLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve struggles with the controls but is getting no where

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't shake her free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though the attacker guns its engine, the CLAMPS below HOL TIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David moves over to the computer to see if he can help. Suddenly the large window slowly begins to DROP DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not me.  They're overriding the system. The blast shield continues to peel away.  David and Steve down below the dash, hiding from view.  As the view becom unobstructed we SEE...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH WINDOW
dialogues.text: Several Alien's looking across at us from the large bay window of the Landing's control tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! David leans from his hiding position and SEES several oth alien attackers are moving in on them.  They are surround

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check and mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like images from England during the blitzkrieg, the refug are huddled on the floor, the lights FLICKERING and the m sounds of distant EXPLOSIONS.  Miguel moves through the refugees, searching for Russell. A Yarmulke is unfolded.  As it is lifted we realize Moish putting it on.  He holds the hands with the people around and begins to pray.  Nimziki moves next to Moishe.  Moish takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not Jewish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP AND ALICIA
dialogues.text: As another bomb rocks the room, Alicia moves closer to Ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could be our last night on Earth.  I don't want to die a virgin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we do, we'll both die virgins. But at last we'll be together. Alicia smiles, a nice guy at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The City Destroyer space ship is settling just above the compound as the American fighters circle it, chased by th attackers.  Below the SCHISM begins to open!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all the commotion, no one notices as Miguel sneaks ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're running out of missiles, Sir.  We're just not causing enough damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're getting ready to fire the big gun.  You're going to have to find a vulnerable spot, fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an idea.  Keep 'em off my tail. Taking the advice, the President DIVES.  He's met by two flanking Fighters (EAGLES 9 & 2) as they cruise the under of the City Destroyer.  Sure enough, the SCHISM is openin preparing to fire the WALL OF DESTRUCTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take 'em out before they take us out. The President locks the SCHISM hatchway into the center o HUD (heads up display).  Just as he FIRES, Eagle 9 is BLO OUT OF THE SKY.  It rocks the President, sending his miss off target. Off balance, the missile hits just wide of the hatchway a EXPLODES, rocking the entire ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out of missiles!  Eagle 2?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it. But before he can target, his fighter EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights continue to flicker.  Jasmine grabs onto Dylan Patricia, holding them tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor we SEE the SCHISM, and BRIGHT LIGHTS as se fighters fly past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're out of time.  Get out of there!  Get as far away as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pissed, the President refuses to give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't anyone have any damned missiles left?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late, Mr. President. The President spins and SEES darting out of the clouds...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSELL'S OLD BI-PLANE
dialogues.text: Russell ZOOMS past the President and alien attackers, bar missing their FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that?  What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Sir.  I'm packin'. We SEE he has a large MISSILES propped up in the seat beh him.  A light on it flashes ARMED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep those guys off me for a few more seconds. Hearing his voice, Miguel is shocked.  He moves closer to the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remaining fighters lay down COVER FIRE for Russell's bi-wing.  Russell heads directly TOWARDS THE SCHISM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is gripped to the screen as we see it get closer closer to the closing bay doors.  Miguel is aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me one favor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell! Miguel races over to the microphone, attempts to grab it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...tell my children I love them very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell nears the SCHISM, a hail of alien firepower erupt around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!  No! Russell smiles at b being called "Dad."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to, kid.  You were always better at taking care of them than I was anyways. Russell turns off his radio as he banks UPWARD towards th open SCHISM.  The climb is steep, and the bi-wing nearly stalls out. Suddenly the bright lights VANISH and the beam begins to Russell's bi-wing just makes it INSIDE THE OPEN SCHISM an disappears from view. The President and remaining fighters BANK AWAY, clearing. Suddenly, A GIGANTIC EXPLOSION, RIPS THROUGH THE CENTER O SPACE CRAFT.  It's causing a CHAIN REACTION of explosion. Teetering, the entire space ship, turns away out of contr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room erupts in CHEERS.  Everyone, that is, except Mig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not far away from Area 51, the enormous craft is burning the center outwards.  Suddenly it DROPS and COLLIDES with mountain range, EXPLODING ON IMPACT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercepting the celebration, General Grey moves over to radio technician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get on the wire.  Tell every squadron around the world how to shoot those fuckers down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting below the dash, Steve takes out the cigars, hands to David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess there's nothing left to do.  Let's nuke 'em. David realizes they're both about to die.  He stares at t cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: cigar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, I always thought things like these would kill me. They share a quick sober laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You as well. Steve lights his cigar, then lights David's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popping up from behind the dash, cigars in their mouths, and David start waving "good-bye" like idiots. The Aliens in the tower don't know how to react.  The attackers move in for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think they know what's coming? He reaches down to the black box we saw before and enters launch code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still waving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a chance in hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the missile ERUPTS from behind the manifold and BLASTS into the control tower, SHATTERING THE GLASS WINDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missile SMASHES through the glass.  The atmosphere impeached, the aliens quickly succumb to the elements, ch and dying. The missile BLASTS by WRECKING equipment until it LODGES the back wall of the Landing tower. A small counter on the missile begins to count down 30:00 29:00, 28:00...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocked from the explosions, the docking clamps RELEASES a ships jostles free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve grabs the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're loose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter.  Game's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hear no fat lady. Steve THROTTLES IT.  The craft JOLTS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and David's attacker BLAST away, the other alien attackers follow in hot pursuit. The attackers FIRE.  Steve SWERVES avoiding the blasts as race for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grasping for breath, a dying Alien looks up at the wedged nuclear missile.  The counter reads: 00:04, 00:03, 00:02. We get the feeling the Alien knows what's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and David's attacker just reaches the doorway as th center of the landing EXPLODES behind them. The enormous impact, rocks some of the lagging attackers track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve DARTS his attacker out from underneath the Mother S belly.  A group of attackers FOLLOW. Just as the last of them exit the docking bay, a HUGE FIR erupts behind them ripping through the Mother Ship.

dialogues.speaker: FARTHER AWAY
dialogues.text: ZOOMING towards us, Steve guides his ship away.  The Alie attackers in hot pursuit.  Behind them we SEE the ENTIRE MOTHER SHIP EXPLODE. The immense EXPLOSION GROWS OUTWARDS coming right at us. ATTACKERS are GOBBLED UP as the EXPLOSION WIDENS.  Quickl explosion gains ground on Steve and David.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE AND DAVID'S SHIP
dialogues.text: Like a loose board caught in the surf, Steve and David's rides the edge of the explosion, getting knocked END OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tumbling ass over tea kettle, David and Steve are ROCKED their seats.  Steve battles to regain control of the ship

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mammoth fireball reaches the outer edge of its zenith Steve and David's ship is SPIT OUT, tumbling down towards EARTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fighters are returning home.  Crowd RACE out of the r of the smoldering compound to greet them, cheering their arrival.

dialogues.speaker: THE PRESIDENT'S PLANE
dialogues.text: The President is climbing out as General Grey rushes to h aid.  Behind him, Jasmine leads Dylan and Patricia, who b free and RUSHES to her father.  The President sweeps her his arms as Jasmine approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to General Grey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word from Steve? Behind her, Constance rushes over, the same thing on her Before he can answer they HEAR a ROAR above.  They all be silent as they turn and look to the skies.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE SKIES
dialogues.text: The FIREBALL COMET is rapidly shooting down towards us. Suddenly BURSTING OUT OF THE FLAMES, Steve and David's sh DARTS DOWN. Just over the heads of the cheering crowds, Steve and Dav ship ZOOMS overhead, disappearing out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several army JEEPS race across the arid desert floor.  As WHIP past we see they are headed towards a gigantic BLACK PLUME OF SMOKE in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeeps SKID to a halt.  Jasmine and Constance are the to leap off the Jeeps. Steve and David walk towards us, cigars in their mouths. Jasmine races over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared the hell out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what an entrance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick-weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butt-munch. Constance comes running up to David, hugs him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet it did. She hugs him.  They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE AND JASMINE
dialogues.text: Behind them Dylan, Patricia, the President and General Gr come walking over.  The President and General Grey approa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting reports from all over.  Their ships are going down! As they begin to celebrate, they look up to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: BRILLIANT LIGHTS IN THE SKIES
dialogues.text: The debris from the Mother Ship explosion enters the atmosphere like thousands of SHOOTING STARS.  It's an incredible sight. The group stares happily at the show in the sky.  Steve t Dylan by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I promise you fireworks? Everyone stares in wonder at the beautiful lights.
